**Scroll of Protection from Traps**

Grants a mystical defense against magical and mechanical **traps**.

- Area of effect: the reader only
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Traps triggered during this time automatically fail or misfire harmlessly
- Cannot be transferred; must be held by the reader
- Scroll crumbles to dust after use

magic_items.name: Rod of Terror
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Undead**

This ancient scroll radiates a field that repels **undead creatures**.

- Radius: 10 feet
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Turned undead behave as if repelled by a high-level cleric
- Intelligent undead may seek alternate routes or test the barrier
- Scroll must be actively held; ends if dropped

magic_items.name: Rod of Wonder
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Elementals**

This scroll provides protection from one of the four elemental types: Air, Earth, Fire, or Water (determined randomly or by DM discretion).

- Creates a 10-ft. radius barrier that **elementals of the specified type cannot penetrate**
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Scroll must be held and concentrated on
- Elementals instinctively avoid the area unless commanded to test it by a summoner
- A favorite among conjurers or planar travelers

magic_items.name: Rod of Flailing
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Magic**

This powerful scroll creates a field that renders the user **immune to all forms of magic**.

- Area: 5-ft. radius sphere around the reader
- Duration: 1d4+6 rounds
- While inside the sphere, the user cannot be affected by magical spells, devices, or effects
- The protected cannot cast spells or receive magical healing during this time
- Scroll is destroyed after one use

magic_items.name: Rod of Withering
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Petrification**

Wards the bearer against any form of **petrification**.

- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Covers the reader only
- Prevents effects from basilisk gaze, cockatrice bites, flesh to stone spells, etc.
- Does not block physical attacks—only magical or monster-based petrifying effects

magic_items.name: Rod of Security
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Energy Drain**

Grants complete protection from **level-draining effects**.

- Affects creatures like vampires, wights, spectres, etc.
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Area: Reader only
- Scroll bearer cannot lose experience levels during the protection
- Must be carried on the person to remain active

magic_items.name: Wand of Cold
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Shapechangers**

This scroll wards off creatures that **change shape**, including lycanthropes, doppelgangers, and polymorphed beings.

- Creates a 10-ft. radius barrier
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Affected creatures cannot enter or attack into the protected zone
- The effect ends early if the scroll is dropped or destroyed

magic_items.name: Wand of Fear
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Lycanthropes**

This scroll creates a barrier against lycanthropes of all kinds (true or infected).

- 10-foot radius circle of protection
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Lycanthropes may not enter the barrier or attack into it
- The scroll must be held and focused upon to remain active
- Ends immediately if the scroll is dropped or destroyed

magic_items.name: Wand of Fire
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Plants**

A rare scroll that shields the reader from aggressive or enchanted plants.

- Includes protection from magical vines, assassin vines, treants, shambling mounds, etc.
- 10-ft radius effect
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Affected creatures cannot penetrate the protective circle
- Particularly valued in cursed or jungle terrain

magic_items.name: Wand of Frost
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Slimes**

Protects the bearer from oozes, slimes, puddings, and similar amorphous creatures.

- 10-ft radius circle blocks entry and attack from such monsters
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- Does not repel spells or magical effects cast by such creatures if they possess them
- Scroll becomes non-magical after one use

magic_items.name: Wand of Illumination
magic_items.description:
**Scroll of Protection from Spirits**

This scroll repels incorporeal undead and similar spiritual beings.

- Includes ghosts, spectres, and wraiths
- Duration: 5d4 rounds
- A 10-ft radius zone that cannot be entered or seen into by spirits
- Does not affect physical undead
- Scroll crumbles after use

magic_items.name: Wand of Lightning
magic_items.description:
**Cursed Scroll**

This dangerous item appears as a standard magical scroll but inflicts a curse when read.

- The effect may vary but is always negative and harmful
- Examples: aging 10 years, reducing an ability score to 3, polymorphing the reader into a harmless creature, teleporting them to a random plane, etc.
- Only powerful magic (*remove curse*, *wish*) can reverse the effect
- Cursed scrolls radiate faint magical auras if tested
- Often used as traps or false treasure

magic_items.name: Wand of Magic Detection
magic_items.description:
This wand functions as the *detect magic* spell.

- Range: 60 feet in a 10-ft. wide path
- Duration: 5 rounds per charge
- No concentration required while active
- Cannot penetrate lead or magical barriers

magic_items.name: Wand of Metal and Mineral Detection
magic_items.description:
Allows the user to detect specific metals or minerals.

- Range: 20 ft. radius
- Duration: 1 turn per charge
- Can detect gold, silver, platinum, copper, iron, gems, or specific minerals if known
- Useful for dungeon exploration or treasure hunting

magic_items.name: Wand of Negation
magic_items.description:
This wand can deactivate the powers of another magical item temporarily.

- Touch attack required; roll to hit if in combat
- Target must save vs. wand or lose magical function for 1d4 rounds
- Does not affect artifacts or relics
- Uses 1 charge per attempt

magic_items.name: Wand of Paralyzation
magic_items.description:
This wand projects a ray that paralyzes creatures in its path.

- Range: 60 feet
- Area: 20-ft. long, 5-ft. wide beam
- All targets must save vs. wand or be paralyzed for 6 rounds
- 1 charge per use; max 50 charges

magic_items.name: Wand of Polymorphing
magic_items.description:
This wand allows the user to polymorph a target creature into another form, as per the *polymorph other* spell.

- Range: 60 feet
- Target must save vs. wand or be transformed permanently (unless dispelled)
- Form chosen by the wand wielder
- Each use costs 1 charge
- Cannot be used on unwilling undead or constructs

magic_items.name: Wand of Secret Door and Trap Location
magic_items.description:
This wand detects secret doors, hidden panels, and traps.

- Range: 30 feet
- Duration: 1 turn per charge
- Reveals false walls, concealed passages, and magical traps
- May not reveal natural hazards or mechanical flaws

magic_items.name: Wand of Silence
magic_items.description:
Emits a 15-foot radius sphere of magical silence.

- Range: 60 feet
- Duration: 5 rounds per charge
- Prevents all sound in the area (speech, spellcasting, etc.)
- Does not block other forms of communication (e.g. telepathy)

magic_items.name: Wand of Wonder
magic_items.description:
This wand produces wildly unpredictable magical effects. Each use requires rolling on the Wand of Wonder table (1d100).

Possible effects include:
- Fireball, stinking cloud, confusion, lightning bolt, grass growth, butterflies, invisibility, and more
- May cause reverse or humorous effects
- Range: 60 feet, area varies
- Each use costs 1 charge
- Highly prized by chaotic magic-users and pranksters

magic_items.name: Wand of Enemy Detection
magic_items.description:
Reveals the presence and direction of enemies within range.

- Range: 60-foot radius
- Duration: 1 turn per charge
- Detects creatures with hostile intent
- Does not distinguish types or exact numbers
- Ineffective against undead or mindless constructs

magic_items.name: Staff of the Archmage
magic_items.description:
This is one of the most powerful staves known. It can only be used by a 12th-level or higher wizard.

- It acts as a quarterstaff +2 when used in melee combat.
- It bestows a +2 bonus to all saving throws against magical attacks.
- It has 25 charges and can cast the following spells:

  | Spell           | Charges Used |
  |------------------|--------------|
  | Dispel Magic     | 2            |
  | Fireball         | 1            |
  | Lightning Bolt   | 1            |
  | Shield           | 1            |

- It also has the power to absorb magical spells, as if it were a ring of absorption. It can absorb up to 50 spell levels before its capacity is exhausted.
- The staff cannot be recharged. When all of its charges are used, the staff crumbles to dust.

magic_items.name: Staff of Command
magic_items.description:
This staff gives the wielder great influence over others.

- It can cast the following spells:

  | Spell             | Charges Used |
  |--------------------|--------------|
  | Command            | 1            |
  | Charm Person       | 1            |
  | Suggestion         | 1            |
  | Domination         | 2            |

- Range for all effects: 60 feet.
- The number of charges ranges from 20–50 (1d31+19).
- Targets are entitled to saving throws as appropriate for the spell.

magic_items.name: Staff of Curing
magic_items.description:
This staff is commonly used by priests, druids, or paladins.

- It may cast the following spells:

  | Spell               | Charges Used |
  |----------------------|--------------|
  | Cure Light Wounds    | 1            |
  | Cure Serious Wounds  | 2            |
  | Neutralize Poison    | 2            |
  | Cure Disease         | 3            |

- The staff contains 10–60 charges (1d6×10).
- Charges are only expended when the effect is successful.
- Cannot be used in combat offensively.

magic_items.name: Staff of Healing
magic_items.description:
This item is prized by groups that expect heavy damage.

- It may cast the following spells:

  | Spell               | Charges Used |
  |----------------------|--------------|
  | Cure Light Wounds    | 1            |
  | Cure Serious Wounds  | 2            |
  | Heal                 | 3            |

- It may be used up to three times per day.
- Recharges naturally at a rate of 1 charge per day of rest in a sacred or holy site.
- Only usable by priests or paladins.

magic_items.name: Staff of Power
magic_items.description:
One of the most potent magical staves.

- It functions as a +2 weapon.
- Contains 20–100 charges (1d8×10+20).
- Capable of casting numerous spells:

  | Spell             | Charges Used |
  |--------------------|--------------|
  | Magic Missile      | 1            |
  | Fireball           | 1            |
  | Lightning Bolt     | 1            |
  | Wall of Force      | 2            |
  | Invisibility       | 2            |
  | Cone of Cold       | 3            |

- **Retributive Strike**: The user may break the staff to unleash a massive explosion:
  - 8d6–64 damage (based on remaining charges)
  - 30-ft radius
  - User must save vs. death magic or be vaporized

magic_items.name: Staff of Striking
magic_items.description:
This staff functions as a +3 magical weapon and has special power when charged:

- Uncharged: +3 to hit and damage in melee.
- Charged (1 charge per hit): On a successful hit, inflicts an additional 2d6 damage.
- Contains 10–30 charges (1d21+9).
- When all charges are used, the staff remains a +3 weapon with no bonus damage.
- Cannot be recharged.

magic_items.name: Staff of Swarming Insects
magic_items.description:
This staff allows the wielder to summon biting insects.

- Summons a swarm of insects to surround a target (10-ft. radius cloud).
- Causes obscured vision, prevents spellcasting, and imposes -2 penalties to attack rolls and saving throws.
- Creatures must make morale checks or flee.
- Staff contains 10–50 charges.
- 1 charge per use. Each swarm lasts 1 round per level of the caster.
- Especially useful against spellcasters.

magic_items.name: Staff of the Serpent
magic_items.description:
This magical staff can transform into a living snake. Two versions exist:

- **Constrictor**:
  - AC 5, 30 HP, attacks for 2d4 damage.
  - Can grapple and constrict a victim.
- **Viper**:
  - AC 3, 20 HP, bites for 1d4 and delivers poison (save or die).

- Can transform into a snake once per day.
- Remains active for 1 turn per level of the wielder or until dismissed.
- Reverts if slain; otherwise reusable the next day.

magic_items.name: Staff of Thunder and Lightning
magic_items.description:
This staff has several dramatic magical powers:

- Acts as a +2 weapon in melee.
- Casts the following spells:

  | Power                    | Charges | Use Frequency |
  |--------------------------|---------|----------------|
  | Lightning Bolt (9d6 dmg) | 1       | 1/day          |
  | Thunderclap (deafens)   | 1       | 1/day          |
  | Thunder & Lightning      | 2       | 1/day          |

- Thunderclap deafens targets in a 10-ft. radius for 2d6 rounds (save negates).
- Staff has 10–50 charges and cannot be recharged.

magic_items.name: Staff of Withering
magic_items.description:
A dreadful weapon used to sap the vitality of its victims.

- On a successful hit, target must save vs. spell or lose 1d6 points of Strength and Dexterity permanently.
- A second failed save results in additional loss.
- Damage cannot be restored except by a *wish* or divine intervention.
- Each use consumes 1 charge. Contains 10–40 charges (1d31+9).
- Especially feared among necromancers and evil priests.

magic_items.name: Staff-Mace
magic_items.description:
This item appears as a magical staff, but its head is shaped like a heavy flanged mace.

- Functions as a **+3 footman’s mace** in all respects.
- It does **1d6+3 damage vs. S/M** and **1d8+3 vs. L** targets.
- It has **no charges** and **no spellcasting abilities**.
- It is popular among militant clerics and those who wish a powerful blunt weapon that is not obviously magical.

magic_items.name: Staff-Spear
magic_items.description:
This item resembles a quarterstaff with a hidden spear tip.

- Acts as a **+2 spear** that can be used in melee or to thrust from a second rank.
- Inflicts **1d6+2 vs. S/M** and **1d8+2 vs. L** targets.
- It has **no magical charges** and does not cast spells.
- Its primary use is for deception or for spellcasters wishing a versatile weapon.

magic_items.name: Book of Infinite Spells
magic_items.description:
**Book of Infinite Spells**

This book contains a number of magical pages that vary in content each time the book is opened. The book is usable by all character classes.

- Each time the book is opened, a new page becomes visible, displaying a randomly determined wizard or priest spell.
- The user can cast the visible spell once per day as if they were a spellcaster of the appropriate class and minimum level required.
- Once a user decides to fix a page (instead of revealing a new one), the page becomes permanent and the spell can be used daily.
- Once a page is fixed, it cannot be changed, and no new pages can be revealed.
- The book contains 1d20+10 pages. Each can be fixed once. When all are fixed or destroyed, the book becomes inert.
- Non-casters must make a saving throw vs. spell to successfully activate the spell.

magic_items.name: Manual of Bodily Health
magic_items.description:
**Manual of Bodily Health**

Reading this manual carefully over a 30-day period permanently increases the character's Constitution score by 1 point.

- The study must be uninterrupted and exclusive for the full duration.
- This bonus applies to all benefits from Constitution: hit point bonuses, system shock rolls, and resurrection survival.
- Once used, the book loses its magic and cannot benefit any other reader.

magic_items.name: Manual of Gainful Exercise
magic_items.description:
**Manual of Gainful Exercise**

This thick tome enhances the Strength of its reader.

- A character who spends 30 consecutive days reading this book increases their Strength score by 1 point permanently.
- Only one such improvement is allowed per character.
- The manual vanishes in a puff of smoke or crumbles to dust once used.

magic_items.name: Manual of Puissant Skill at Arms
magic_items.description:
**Manual of Puissant Skill at Arms**

This work is filled with diagrams, battle exercises, and warrior philosophies.

- A fighter who studies this manual over 30 days of undisturbed practice gains a permanent +1 bonus to their THAC0.
- Only fighter-class characters can benefit from this manual.
- After use, the book disintegrates or loses all magic.

magic_items.name: Manual of Quickness of Action
magic_items.description:
**Manual of Quickness of Action**

This slender tome imparts lessons in agility and reflex.

- Grants a permanent +1 bonus to Dexterity after 30 uninterrupted days of study.
- The effects apply to AC, missile attack bonuses, and initiative modifiers.
- Once read, the book disappears or crumbles.
- Each character may benefit from this book only once.

magic_items.name: Tome of Clear Thought
magic_items.description:
**Tome of Clear Thought**

This tome is a work of philosophical insight and cognitive mastery.

- A character who reads the tome over 30 uninterrupted days increases their **Intelligence by +1 permanently**.
- The study must be done with no other distractions or adventuring.
- The improvement grants all associated benefits: better spell acquisition, increased languages, and save bonuses.
- Once used, the tome disappears or becomes completely blank and mundane.
- The same individual cannot benefit from another tome of this type.

magic_items.name: Tome of Leadership and Influence
magic_items.description:
**Tome of Leadership and Influence**

A masterwork of oration, diplomacy, and charisma-building techniques.

- After 30 days of devoted study, the reader gains a **permanent +1 bonus to Charisma**.
- Affects reaction adjustments, henchman loyalty, and maximum number of followers.
- The tome becomes non-magical after use.
- A character may only benefit once from a tome of this type.

magic_items.name: Tome of Understanding
magic_items.description:
**Tome of Understanding**

This book of contemplation and spiritual guidance enhances inner wisdom.

- After 30 days of intense reflection and study, the reader’s **Wisdom increases by +1 permanently**.
- Provides better saving throws, and bonus cleric/druid spells if applicable.
- The tome crumbles or vanishes after one complete reading.
- No benefit can be gained from reading it again.

magic_items.name: Tome of Mighty Skill in Combat
magic_items.description:
**Tome of Mighty Skill in Combat**

Filled with battle tactics and physical training regimens, this tome improves martial power.

- Study duration: 30 days of uninterrupted focus
- Result: permanent **+1 bonus to all damage rolls** with weapons
- Tome vanishes or becomes inert once used
- Only usable once per character

magic_items.name: Tome of Stealthy Pilfering
magic_items.description:
**Tome of Stealthy Pilfering**

This text of rogue lore and secret techniques boosts thieving prowess.

- Grants a **+10% permanent bonus to all thieving skills**
- Requires 30 days of study without adventuring or interruption
- Book loses all magic after use
- Thief or thief-like class required to gain any benefit

magic_items.name: Staff of the Woodlands
magic_items.description:
This potent item is usable only by **druids** or **priests of nature**. It is typically made from a gnarled branch of oak or ash, engraved with woodland runes.

- Functions as a **+2 weapon**
- Can cast the following spells (one charge per use):

  - *Entangle*
  - *Barkskin*
  - *Pass Without Trace*
  - *Wall of Thorns*
  - *Animal Summoning I*
  - *Invisibility to Animals*
  - *Speak with Animals*

- Contains **10d10 charges**
- Once per day, the wielder can use *Changestaff* (as the 7th-level priest spell)
- Cannot be used by non-druids
- When its charges are exhausted, the staff becomes non-magical unless recharged by a powerful nature ritual

magic_items.name: Staff of the Magi
magic_items.description:
This powerful staff can only be used by **mages**, and grants both combat and magical benefits:

- Functions as a **+2 weapon**
- Grants a **+1 bonus to all saving throws**
- Spell absorption: Absorbs spells cast at the wielder (up to 50 levels of spells)
- Absorbed spell levels can be used to fuel the following powers (1 charge unless noted):

  - *Detect Magic*
  - *Enlarge* (1 charge)
  - *Light*
  - *Mage Armor*
  - *Shield*
  - *Dispel Magic* (2 charges)
  - *Fireball* (2 charges)
  - *Invisibility* (2 charges)
  - *Lightning Bolt* (2 charges)
  - *Passwall* (3 charges)
  - *Web* (1 charge)
  - *Wall of Fire* (3 charges)
  - *Wall of Ice* (3 charges)
  - *Whirlwind* (4 charges)
  - *Plane Shift* (5 charges)

- The wielder can **break the staff** to cause a retributive strike:
  - Causes 8d6 to 16d6 damage in a 30-ft. radius
  - No save for objects; save vs. spell for half damage for creatures
  - Wielder is teleported to another plane or destroyed (50% chance)

- The staff has **25 charges maximum**
- Cannot be recharged by conventional means

*This legendary item is a symbol of arcane mastery and jealously guarded by archmages.*

magic_items.name: Amulet of Inescapable Location
magic_items.description:
This item gives off a magical aura so powerful that anyone using any form of detection can locate the wearer with ease. The amulet negates the effects of the *amulet of proof against detection and location* or any other device that hides the wearer from magical location.

- Attempts to magically detect or locate the wearer are always successful
- The amulet itself cannot be magically hidden or cloaked
- Often placed among other jewelry as a trap for the unwary

magic_items.name: Amulet of Life Protection
magic_items.description:
This item gives the wearer **immunity to energy drain and death spell effects**.

- Wearer is unaffected by level-draining attacks or death spells
- Provides no protection from hit point loss or physical attacks
- The amulet glows softly when its protection activates
- Commonly sought by adventurers confronting undead

magic_items.name: Amulet of Health
magic_items.description:
This magical item increases the wearer's Constitution to **18**.

- Also grants all benefits of that Constitution (HP bonus, system shock, etc.)
- If the wearer's Constitution is already 18 or higher, the amulet has no additional effect
- If removed, Constitution returns to normal
- Does not heal or restore lost hit points

magic_items.name: Amulet of Proof Against Detection and Location
magic_items.description:
This item protects the wearer from all magical attempts to locate or detect them.

- Completely negates *detect evil*, *detect magic*, *clairvoyance*, *scrying*, etc.
- Wearer becomes effectively invisible to magical detection
- Does not affect physical detection (e.g., footprints, sound)

magic_items.name: Amulet of the Planes
magic_items.description:
This device allows the wearer to travel from plane to plane, much like a *plane shift* spell.

- Requires concentration and familiarity with the destination
- If used properly, the user can travel to any known plane
- If used improperly (25% chance), the user is transported to a random plane
- The DM determines where the character ends up if used incorrectly

magic_items.name: Amulet vs. Crystal Balls and ESP
magic_items.description:
This magical item protects the wearer from all magical scrying and telepathic intrusion.

- Blocks *ESP*, *crystal ball*, and similar scrying spells or devices
- Prevents magical reading of the wearer’s thoughts
- Offers no protection against other divination (e.g. *detect magic*, *clairaudience*)
- Functions continuously while worn

magic_items.name: Amulet vs. Undead
magic_items.description:
This amulet protects the wearer from lesser forms of undead.

- Prevents contact by skeletons, zombies, ghouls, and shadows
- More powerful undead (wights, wraiths, etc.) are not affected
- Protection is passive and continuous
- Works only while worn openly

magic_items.name: Beads of Force
magic_items.description:
These are small black spheres, each the size of a marble.

- Can be thrown up to 30 feet
- Upon impact, explodes with force equal to *shatter* spell
- Causes 5d4 damage (save vs. spell for half)
- Creates a *resilient sphere* (10-ft. radius) for 10 rounds, trapping those inside
- The user typically finds 1d4+2 beads in a pouch

magic_items.name: Beads of Prayer
magic_items.description:
These appear as a string of ornamental prayer beads but are imbued with divine power.

- Each bead functions as a *bless* spell for the wearer and allies in a 10-ft. radius
- Once used, a bead turns to dust
- Typically found in strings of 3d4 beads
- Cannot be recharged or reused

magic_items.name: Brooch of Shielding
magic_items.description:
This brooch appears decorative but has magical protective properties.

- Absorbs *magic missile* spells directed at the wearer
- Can absorb 101 points of damage before disintegrating
- Does not function against other forms of magical attack
- Functions continuously until depleted

magic_items.name: Chime of Interruption
magic_items.description:
This magical chime disrupts spellcasting and magical effects when struck.

- Sounds a clear note when activated
- Any creature casting a spell within 30 feet must make a saving throw vs. spell or fail to cast
- Can be used once per round
- Effective for up to 10 rounds per day
- Especially useful for interrupting enemy spellcasters

magic_items.name: Chime of Opening
magic_items.description:
This finely tuned chime opens locked or magically held doors and containers.

- Can be used up to 10 times before becoming inert
- Has a 10-ft. range
- Opens barred, locked, or wizard locked doors as if by *knock* spell
- Does not disarm traps

magic_items.name: Crystal Hypnosis Ball
magic_items.description:
This item is similar to a crystal ball but functions with hypnotic suggestion.

- Allows viewing of a creature or area, as per *clairvoyance*
- Viewer can attempt to **suggest** an action to the observed creature (save vs. spell negates)
- Creature must be intelligent and within line of sight of the viewed area
- Suggestion functions as the *suggestion* spell
- Can be used 3 times per day

magic_items.name: Crystal Ball
magic_items.description:
This scrying device allows the user to view distant persons or places.

- Functions as *clairvoyance* or *scrying* spell
- Range is limited to the same plane of existence
- Viewer must concentrate to maintain the image
- Some versions have additional abilities:

  - With ESP
  - With Telepathy
  - With Clairaudience
  - With True Seeing (DM's discretion)

- Interference from lead, magical protections, or extra-planar barriers may occur

magic_items.name: Dust of Appearance
magic_items.description:
This powder outlines invisible creatures and objects with sparkling motes.

- A single handful affects a 10-ft. radius
- Makes invisible targets fully visible for 5d4 rounds
- Also reveals illusions, mirror images, and concealment spells
- Does not deal damage but can break concealment-based tactics
- Found in silk pouches containing 2d4 applications

magic_items.name: Earring of Protection
magic_items.description:
This tiny hoop or stud grants magical protection similar to a ring.

- +1 to saving throws and +1 to AC
- Works only while worn in a pierced ear
- Wearing more than one has no additional effect
- Incompatible with other magical protection items of the same type

magic_items.name: Gem of Brightness
magic_items.description:
This crystal emits brilliant light when activated.

- 50 charges total
- Can be used in three modes:

  1. *Light Beam*: Illuminates 30-ft. cone for 10 rounds (1 charge)
  2. *Flare*: Blinds creatures in a 10-ft. cone (save negates, 1 charge)
  3. *Sunburst*: Powerful burst affecting all within 30-ft. radius (2d4 damage, save for half, 2 charges)

- Recharges are not possible

magic_items.name: Gem of Insight
magic_items.description:
This gem grants great mental clarity and heightened awareness.

- Increases Wisdom by +2 permanently (once used)
- Grants a +10% bonus to experience point awards for future adventures
- Only functions once per character
- Gem crumbles to dust after use

magic_items.name: Gem of Seeing
magic_items.description:
This crystal allows the user to see things as they truly are.

- Activates true seeing (as spell) for 5 rounds per charge
- 50 charges maximum
- Can see invisible, hidden, polymorphed, ethereal, or illusionary things
- Essential for identifying magical trickery and disguise

magic_items.name: Horn of Blasting
magic_items.description:
When blown, this horn releases a **blast of sonic force**.

- Causes 5d6 damage in a 30-foot cone (save vs. spell for half)
- Also shatters fragile items, knocks creatures prone
- 1 use per round; 5 uses per day
- 1-in-20 chance each use that the horn explodes, causing 10d6 to the user

magic_items.name: Medallion of ESP
magic_items.description:
This magical item allows the wearer to read surface thoughts.

- Range: 90 feet
- Functions as the *ESP* spell
- Lasts for 5 rounds per activation
- 50 charges maximum
- Cannot read thoughts of unintelligent or non-sentient creatures

magic_items.name: Medallion of ESP (Cursed)
magic_items.description:
This item looks like a normal *medallion of ESP* but functions differently.

- When activated, causes wearer to receive *jumbled thoughts*, confusion
- 50% chance wearer is stunned for 1d4 rounds
- Does not allow actual ESP use
- Considered cursed and hard to remove without magical aid

magic_items.name: Necklace of Adaptation
magic_items.description:
This necklace surrounds the wearer with a magical bubble of clean air.

- Wearer can breathe in any atmosphere (including water)
- Immune to gas-based attacks (e.g., *stinking cloud*, *cloudkill*)
- Prevents drowning or asphyxiation
- Does not protect against pressure, temperature, or non-air effects

magic_items.name: Necklace of Fireballs
magic_items.description:
This item appears as a string of beads, each one a contained *fireball* spell.

- Throwing a bead releases a fireball of appropriate level:

  - Type I: 1d6 damage
  - Type II: 2d6 damage
  - Type III: 3d6 damage
  - …up to Type VII (7d6)

- All beads may be thrown separately or together
- Save vs. spell for half damage
- If the wearer fails a save vs. fire while wearing it, **entire necklace explodes**

magic_items.name: Necklace of Missiles
magic_items.description:
Similar to the *necklace of fireballs*, this item contains explosive magical projectiles.

- Beads can be detached and thrown
- Each bead releases a fireball effect, dealing 5d6 damage (save for half)
- The number and size of beads vary by necklace type
- Throwing all beads at once causes a massive combined explosion
- Explosion risk if wearer is hit by fire damage

magic_items.name: Periapt of Foul Rotting
magic_items.description:
This cursed item appears as a beneficial periapt.

- After 1d6 days, the wearer begins suffering from rotting flesh
- Charisma drops by 1 each day until 1
- No healing is possible while worn
- Only *remove curse* and *cure disease* can end the effect

magic_items.name: Periapt of Health
magic_items.description:
This item grants complete immunity to disease.

- Protects against magical, magical creature-induced, and mundane diseases
- Includes mummy rot, lycanthropy (disease variant), etc.
- Works continuously while worn

magic_items.name: Periapt of Proof Against Poison
magic_items.description:
This fine jewel protects the wearer from poison.

- Automatically negates poison from ingestion, injury, or inhalation
- Does not protect against magical poison unless specified
- Glows green when neutralizing a dose

magic_items.name: Periapt of Wound Closure
magic_items.description:
This gem speeds natural healing and stops bleeding.

- Wearer heals at twice the normal rate
- Automatically stabilizes the wearer when reduced below 0 HP
- Greatly valued by frontline warriors and healers

magic_items.name: Phylactery of Faithfulness
magic_items.description:
This holy item warns the wearer when they're about to commit an alignment violation.

- Glows, pulses, or tingles as a warning
- Does not prevent action but allows forethought
- Commonly worn by paladins, clerics, and lawful characters

magic_items.name: Rope of Climbing
magic_items.description:
This rope obeys commands and assists in climbing.

- Up to 60 feet long, very strong
- Climbs vertically, ties itself, and knots/unknots on command
- Supports 3,000 lbs. weight
- Useful for scaling walls and escaping pits

magic_items.name: Rope of Entanglement
magic_items.description:
This rope animates and entangles targets at command.

- Range: 20 ft
- Target must save vs. spell or be bound for 5 rounds
- Acts as if under *entangle* spell
- Can attempt to entangle once per round

magic_items.name: Scarab of Enraging Enemies
magic_items.description:
This cursed scarab causes enemies to become more aggressive toward the wearer.

- Increases chance to be attacked
- Creatures with morale ratings receive +2 to checks
- Found among useful magical items to deceive victims

magic_items.name: Scarab of Insanity
magic_items.description:
This cursed scarab slowly drives the wearer mad.

- After 1d6 days, wearer begins hallucinating and behaving irrationally
- Save vs. spell daily to resist
- Remove curse is required to discard

magic_items.name: Scarab of Protection
magic_items.description:
This item offers protection from various magical effects.

- Grants +1 to all saving throws
- Absorbs 12 spell levels of harmful magic (e.g. *finger of death*, *disintegrate*)
- Glows when absorbing a spell, then darkens permanently when depleted

magic_items.name: Talisman of Alchemy
magic_items.description:
This talisman improves success rates for an alchemist’s work.

- +15% to success rolls for potion or magical mixture creation
- Required by many advanced alchemical techniques
- Useless in combat

magic_items.name: Talisman of Pure Good
magic_items.description:
A lawful good cleric can use this talisman to smite evil.

- When touched to an evil creature, the target must save vs. spell
- On a failed save, the creature is sent to its home plane or destroyed
- Usable once per day
- Only usable by lawful good priests

magic_items.name: Talisman of Reluctant Wishes
magic_items.description:
This talisman grants 3 wishes, but grudgingly.

- Each time a wish is made, there is a 50% chance of a twisted interpretation
- Wishes function as the *wish* spell but often with ironic results
- After 3 uses, the talisman crumbles to dust

magic_items.name: Talisman of the Sphere
magic_items.description:
This talisman grants control over *sphere of annihilation*.

- +4 bonus on control checks
- Can summon or dispel a known sphere
- Only works for those who have seen or studied a sphere

magic_items.name: Talisman of Ultimate Evil
magic_items.description:
Functions like the *talisman of pure good* but for chaotic evil clerics.

- Instantly destroys good creatures touched (if they fail save)
- Only usable by chaotic evil priests
- 1 use per day

magic_items.name: Talisman of Ultimate Good
magic_items.description:
Same as *talisman of pure good*, but with greater power.

- No saving throw for evil targets
- Usable only by lawful good priests
- Must be touched to target

magic_items.name: Talisman of Zagy
magic_items.description:
This artifact of chaotic nature has unpredictable powers.

- Once per day, cast a random high-level spell
- Each time used, user must save vs. spell or be transformed permanently (DM's choice)
- Found only in the most dangerous treasure hoards

magic_items.name: Cloak of Arachnida
magic_items.description:
This cloak is made of black silk interwoven with strands of silver and has the following magical properties:

- Grants the wearer immunity to entrapment by webs (magical or otherwise).
- Allows the wearer to move in webs at full movement rate.
- Once per day, the wearer can cast *web* as if by a 10th-level wizard.
- Grants +2 to saving throws against poison from spiders.
- Allows the wearer to climb as if under a *spider climb* spell.

The cloak has a subtle spider motif and shimmers faintly in moonlight.

magic_items.name: Cloak of the Bat
magic_items.description:
This item resembles a dark, leathery cloak with wing-like folds. While worn:

- Wearer can hang upside down from ceilings like a bat.
- Can glide, up to 40 feet forward for every 10 feet of fall distance.
- If in darkness, the wearer may polymorph into a normal bat at will (as *polymorph self*, 7 rounds duration).
- Usable once per night, the transformation allows flight with the speed and maneuverability of a bat.
- While transformed, no speech or spellcasting is possible.

magic_items.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
magic_items.description:
Wearing this cloak grants exceptional stealth capabilities:

- In outdoor natural surroundings, grants +90% to Hide in Shadows.
- Indoors or underground, the bonus is +50%.
- Functions only if the wearer remains still.
- May not function for non-elves unless attuned by an elf.
- Color blends with surroundings, making wearer almost invisible.

magic_items.name: Cloak of Etherealness
magic_items.description:
When this cloak is worn and its command word spoken, the wearer becomes ethereal, as per the *etherealness* spell:

- Duration: up to 1 hour per day (continuous or divided).
- While ethereal, the wearer can move through solid objects and is invisible and intangible on the Prime Material Plane.
- The cloak cannot be used again until the duration has elapsed.
- The effect ends instantly if the cloak is removed or dispelled.

magic_items.name: Cloak of Protection +1
magic_items.description:
This magical cloak bestows a +1 bonus to Armor Class and all saving throws.

- The cloak must be worn to be effective.
- Bonuses stack with magical armor or rings of protection unless otherwise noted.
- Appears as a finely made cloak of high-quality material, often in muted tones.
- Some versions may be enchanted with faint symbols or runes.

magic_items.name: Cloak of Protection +2
magic_items.description:
Functions like a +1 cloak of protection, but with increased benefit:

- Grants +2 bonus to Armor Class and all saving throws.
- Usable by all classes unless otherwise restricted.
- May be elaborately decorated depending on origin.

magic_items.name: Cloak of Protection +3
magic_items.description:
Provides the same benefits as other cloaks of protection, but stronger:

- +3 bonus to AC and saving throws.
- May radiate stronger magical aura than lower-grade cloaks.
- Highly prized by adventurers and royalty alike.

magic_items.name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
magic_items.description:
This cloak resembles a manta ray when spread out in the water.

- Enables the wearer to breathe underwater and swim at 18" movement rate.
- Fins and tail extend when the cloak is activated in water.
- Wearer gains a swim movement rate equal to a manta ray.
- Provides no benefit out of water or on land.

magic_items.name: Robe of Blending
magic_items.description:
This robe allows the wearer to blend in with surroundings like a chameleon:

- Wearer receives a +20% bonus to Hide in Shadows and Move Silently.
- Grants advantage against detection by visual means.
- Can also be used to disguise the wearer magically (as *alter self* at will).
- Function is suppressed if robe is removed or wearer is polymorphed.

magic_items.name: Robe of Eyes
magic_items.description:
This robe is covered with embroidered or actual magical eyes that remain closed until worn:

- Wearer gains 360° vision, cannot be surprised.
- Sees invisible, ethereal, and hidden creatures within 120 feet.
- Wearer cannot avert gaze and suffers effects of gaze attacks (e.g., basilisk).
- *Light* or *continual light* cast on the robe blinds the wearer for 1d6 rounds.

magic_items.name: Robe of Scintillating Colors
magic_items.description:
When activated (up to 10 rounds per day), this robe flashes shifting, dazzling patterns:

- Wearer becomes harder to hit: AC improved by 1 per 3 levels (max -5).
- All creatures within 30 feet must save vs. spell or be dazed (lose 1 action).
- The robe’s effect can be ended voluntarily or when 10 rounds are used.
- Recharge requires 8 hours without use.

magic_items.name: Robe of Stars
magic_items.description:
A robe embroidered with silver stars, it grants the following benefits:

- Acts as +1 cloak of protection (AC and saves).
- Contains 1d4+2 magical star pins that can be thrown as +5 daggers (1/day each).
- Wearer can enter the Astral Plane at will.
- Once all stars are used, the robe still functions as a cloak of protection.

magic_items.name: Robe of Useful Items
magic_items.description:
This robe has various patches, each depicting a common item. When detached, the item becomes real:

- Common patches include: ladder, rowboat, window, door, pole, food, animal, coins, etc.
- Each robe has a standard set of patches and 2d4 additional ones.
- Once removed, patches cannot be replaced.
- Extremely useful for quick access to mundane but important items.

magic_items.name: Cloak of Displacement
magic_items.description:
This cloak creates a subtle shifting of the wearer's image, making them appear to be several inches away from their actual location.

- Grants a -2 bonus to Armor Class and saving throws vs. attacks that require physical targeting.
- Some versions (rarer) provide a -4 bonus (DM’s discretion).
- The displacement effect is negated if the cloak is not worn or if the wearer is polymorphed.
- Has no effect against area attacks such as *fireball* or *cloudkill*.

magic_items.name: Cloak of Poisonousness
magic_items.description:
This cloak appears to be a magical cloak of protection or displacement. However, when it is worn, it immediately poisons the wearer.

- The wearer must make a saving throw vs. poison.
- If failed, the poison is fatal in 1d6 rounds unless a *neutralize poison* spell is used.
- Even if the save succeeds, the cloak causes great pain and nausea (–2 to all rolls for 2d4 rounds).
- The cloak cannot be removed without a *remove curse* spell.

magic_items.name: Robe of the Archmagi
magic_items.description:
This robe provides the following benefits to any wizard wearing it:

- Functions as a cloak of protection +5 and grants magic resistance 15%.
- Acts as bracers of defense AC 5.
- Comes in neutral (gray), good (white), or evil (black) variations.
- Alignment must match or the robe functions as a *robe of powerlessness*.
- Only usable by wizards.
- Cannot be worn with armor or bracers.

magic_items.name: Robe of Powerlessness
magic_items.description:
This cursed robe appears identical to a *robe of the archmagi*.

- When worn, it causes the wearer to suffer a –4 penalty on attack rolls and saving throws.
- Strength is reduced to 3 while worn.
- The robe can only be removed with a *remove curse* spell.
- The wearer is unaware of these effects until they attempt a significant action (e.g., combat or saving throw).

magic_items.name: Robe of Vermin
magic_items.description:
This robe appears as a normal robe, often similar to a *robe of useful items*.

- When worn, the robe seems to squirm slightly.
- In 1d6 rounds, insects (maggots, beetles, worms, etc.) begin crawling out of the lining.
- These vermin distract and disgust the wearer, imposing –2 on all attack rolls and saving throws.
- Only *remove curse* allows the robe to be discarded.

magic_items.name: Boots of Dancing
magic_items.description:
These cursed boots appear to be beneficial magical footwear, such as boots of speed.

- When worn, they operate normally for 1d4+1 days.
- After that, the wearer is compelled to dance whenever they try to move.
- The wearer cannot engage in combat or perform other actions while dancing.
- A *remove curse* spell is required to take them off.

magic_items.name: Boots of Elvenkind
magic_items.description:
These soft boots enable the wearer to move almost silently:

- Wearer gains +90% bonus to Move Silently checks.
- Useful in both natural and dungeon environments.
- Does not negate armor penalties.
- No sound is made from normal footfalls unless the ground is especially noisy.

magic_items.name: Boots of Levitation
magic_items.description:
These boots allow the wearer to levitate, as per the *levitate* spell:

- Up to 6 turns of levitation per day.
- Direction and rate of ascent/descent is controlled mentally.
- Lateral movement must be assisted by pushing against solid objects or using other spells.

magic_items.name: Boots of Speed
magic_items.description:
These boots enable the wearer to run at double normal speed and gain extra attacks per round:

- Grants the effects of the *haste* spell for 10 rounds/day.
- Can be used all at once or in multiple shorter bursts.
- While active, increases movement, AC, and number of attacks.
- When the daily duration expires, the wearer must rest for twice that amount of time.

magic_items.name: Boots of Striding and Springing
magic_items.description:
These magical boots increase movement rate and jumping ability:

- Movement rate becomes 12, regardless of encumbrance.
- Wearer can leap up to 30 feet forward or 9 feet upward.
- Jumping requires a 10-foot running start; halved if standing.
- Landing is always sure-footed unless surface is magically slick.

magic_items.name: Boots of Dancing
magic_items.description:
These boots initially appear to be useful magical boots, but are actually cursed.

- When worn, they cause the wearer to dance uncontrollably whenever music is heard.
- The wearer cannot stop dancing for the duration of the music plus 1d4 rounds thereafter.
- While dancing, the wearer is unable to fight, cast spells, or perform complex actions.
- Only a *remove curse* spell allows the boots to be removed.

magic_items.name: Boots of Elvenkind
magic_items.description:
These soft boots allow the wearer to move almost silently.

- Wearer receives a +90% bonus to Move Silently checks.
- Useful for sneaking past guards, monsters, or while exploring dungeons.
- No bonus if the wearer is running or moving in heavy armor.
- Function only when worn in pairs and in reasonably quiet surroundings.

magic_items.name: Boots of Levitation
magic_items.description:
These boots allow the wearer to levitate at will, as per the *levitate* spell.

- Usable once per round by mental command.
- The user may rise or descend vertically up to 20 feet per round.
- Lateral movement must be aided by external force (e.g., pushing from a wall).
- Duration is unlimited, but requires concentration to maintain.

magic_items.name: Boots of Speed
magic_items.description:
These boots allow the wearer to move at double their normal speed.

- Duration: up to 10 rounds per day (can be split across rounds).
- While active, grants +2 to Armor Class and +2 on initiative rolls.
- Increases number of melee attacks per round by 1 (to a max of 2).
- After 10 rounds of use, the boots require 12 hours to recharge.

magic_items.name: Boots of Striding and Springing
magic_items.description:
These boots allow the wearer to cover great distances with ease.

- Normal movement rate is doubled without fatigue.
- Allows leaping 30 feet forward or 10 feet backward or straight up.
- The boots negate damage from jumping or falling up to 10 feet.
- Used by scouts, messengers, or anyone needing swift travel.

magic_items.name: Boots of the North
magic_items.description:
These boots protect the wearer from cold and improve travel over snow and ice:

- Wearer suffers no movement penalties in snow or icy terrain.
- Provides full protection from natural cold.
- Grants +2 bonus to saving throws vs. cold-based magical attacks.
- Often worn by rangers, barbarians, or mountain-dwelling adventurers.

magic_items.name: Boots of Varied Tracks
magic_items.description:
These enchanted boots alter the wearer's footprints:

- Tracks left appear to belong to another creature type (determined randomly or by the DM).
- Each set of prints changes every 1d4 hours.
- Can resemble animals, monsters, or humanoid types.
- Does not affect weight, sound, or smell—only visual tracks.

magic_items.name: Boots, Winged
magic_items.description:
These boots sprout small wings when activated, allowing flight:

- Flight speed: 18 with Class C maneuverability.
- Duration: up to 1 hour/day (continuous or split).
- Activation is mental; deactivates automatically when removed.
- Cannot be used while wearing medium or heavy armor.

magic_items.name: Bracers of Archery (Warrior)
magic_items.description:
These bracers improve a warrior's archery skills:

- Wearer gains +2 bonus to attack rolls with bows.
- Must be proficient in bows to benefit.
- Only functions for warriors and ranger-type classes.
- Does not stack with magical bows or arrows.

magic_items.name: Bracers of Brachiation
magic_items.description:
These vine-wrapped bracers allow the wearer to swing from tree to tree like an ape:

- Wearer gains a 60 ft. movement rate in jungle or dense forests.
- Grants +2 bonus on climbing and swinging-related checks.
- If not in wooded terrain, the bracers provide no benefit.
- Popular with jungle natives, druids, and beastmasters.

magic_items.name: Bracers of Defense
magic_items.description:
These magical bracers provide the wearer with an Armor Class as if wearing magical armor:

- Common varieties improve AC to 6, 4, or 2 depending on the enchantment.
- Does not stack with armor or other bracers.
- Popular with wizards and monks who cannot wear armor.
- Only one pair may be worn at a time.

magic_items.name: Bracers of Defenselessness
magic_items.description:
These cursed bracers appear as bracers of defense, but are harmful:

- They reduce the wearer's AC to 10 (no modifiers).
- Cannot be removed without a *remove curse* spell.
- Often used as traps in treasure hoards or by malicious spellcasters.

magic_items.name: Gauntlets of Dexterity
magic_items.description:
These finely crafted gauntlets improve the wearer's agility:

- Grants a +1 bonus to Dexterity (or raises Dexterity to 18, whichever is better).
- Bonus affects AC, missile attacks, initiative, and reaction.
- Does not stack with other magical Dexterity-enhancing items.

magic_items.name: Gauntlets of Fumbling
magic_items.description:
These cursed gauntlets appear beneficial but hinder the wearer:

- Causes wearer to drop anything held 50% of the time.
- Imposes -2 penalty on attack rolls and Dexterity checks.
- Cannot be removed without a *remove curse* spell.

magic_items.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
magic_items.description:
These gauntlets increase the wearer's Strength:

- Raises Strength to 18/00 while worn.
- Bonus applies to hit and damage rolls.
- Only usable by priests, rogues, or warriors.
- Does not stack with girdles of strength or other strength-enhancing items.

magic_items.name: Gauntlets of Swimming and Climbing
magic_items.description:
These gauntlets allow the wearer to swim and climb as if under magical aid:

- Grants +10% bonus to climbing and swimming checks.
- Only usable by priests, rogues, or warriors.
- Does not stack with magical ropes or other aids.

magic_items.name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
magic_items.description:
These gloves allow the wearer to catch or deflect incoming missiles:

- Up to two missile attacks per round can be negated (arrows, bolts, etc.).
- Requires Dexterity 15 or higher to function.
- Does not work against large projectiles or magical missiles.
- Each glove can be used once per round.

magic_items.name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
magic_items.description:
These enchanted slippers grant the ability to walk on walls and ceilings:

- Functions like the *spider climb* spell.
- Lasts for 10 rounds per use, usable 3 times/day.
- Does not allow movement across liquids or gases.

magic_items.name: Girdle of Dwarvenkind
magic_items.description:
This broad belt improves the wearer's constitution and grants dwarven abilities:

- Increases Constitution by 1 point (max 19 for non-dwarves).
- Grants 60-foot infravision.
- +2 bonus on saves vs. poison and magic.
- Grants ability to speak dwarven and recognize stonework, slopes, and traps like a dwarf.
- Wearer is treated as a dwarf for interaction with dwarven magic items or effects.

magic_items.name: Girdle of Femininity/Masculinity
magic_items.description:
This cursed item appears as a useful magical girdle, but when worn, it permanently changes the wearer's gender.

- Effects are instantaneous and permanent unless countered by a *wish* or similar powerful magic.
- May cause complications based on character class, society, or roleplaying implications.
- Cannot be removed by *remove curse* alone.

magic_items.name: Girdle of Giant Strength
magic_items.description:
This enchanted belt grants the tremendous strength of a specific type of giant:

- Wearer gains Strength between 19 and 25 depending on the giant type (DM determines).
- Grants appropriate Strength-based combat bonuses.
- Wearer may perform feats like hurling boulders, breaking doors, or bending bars with ease.
- Only usable by priests, rogues, or warriors.

magic_items.name: Girdle of Many Pouches
magic_items.description:
This unassuming leather belt holds multiple extradimensional pouches:

- Contains 6 to 12 small pouches (DM’s choice).
- Each pouch holds up to 1 cubic foot or 10 pounds.
- Contents are accessible only by the wearer.
- Items are stored and retrieved by command word.
- Useful for smuggling or hiding important gear.

magic_items.name: Hat of Disguise
magic_items.description:
This headpiece allows the wearer to change appearance at will:

- Functions as the *disguise self* spell.
- Illusion affects clothing, race, gender, and minor size shifts.
- Does not alter voice, scent, or feel.
- Can be detected with *true seeing* or similar spells.

magic_items.name: Hat of Stupidity
magic_items.description:
This cursed hat reduces the wearer's intelligence drastically:

- Lowers Intelligence to 3 while worn.
- Wearer cannot use spells, skills, or reason effectively.
- Cannot be removed without a *remove curse* spell.
- Often used as a trap disguised as a helm or hat of intellect.

magic_items.name: Helm of Brilliance
magic_items.description:
This platinum helm is studded with 10 diamonds, 20 rubies, 30 fire opals, and 40 opals:

- Can emit rays of fire, fireballs, prismatic sprays, and produce *wall of fire*.
- Also protects against fire damage.
- Once all gems are used, the helm becomes non-magical.
- If struck by magical fire while charged, it explodes in a 60-ft radius (12d6 damage).
- Extremely powerful, but dangerous if misused.

magic_items.name: Helm of Comprehending Languages and Reading Magic
magic_items.description:
This helm allows the wearer to understand and read unknown languages:

- Grants ability to comprehend spoken and written languages.
- Also functions as *read magic* while worn.
- Useful for deciphering scrolls, runes, or foreign texts.
- Does not confer literacy or magical activation ability beyond reading.

magic_items.name: Helm of Opposite Alignment
magic_items.description:
This cursed helm instantly changes the wearer’s alignment to its exact opposite:

- Lawful Good ↔ Chaotic Evil, Lawful Neutral ↔ Chaotic Neutral, etc.
- The change is undetectable by the wearer.
- Only a *wish* or *atonement* can reverse the effect.
- Often used as a plot device or challenge by devious NPCs.

magic_items.name: Helm of Telepathy
magic_items.description:
This helm grants the wearer the ability to communicate telepathically:

- Can read surface thoughts of creatures within 90 feet.
- Allows two-way mental communication if target is willing.
- Can be used to issue *suggestion* once per day (as per spell).
- May trigger backlash from psychic creatures if used recklessly.

magic_items.name: Helm of Teleportation
magic_items.description:
This helm allows the wearer to teleport, as per the spell:

- Up to three times per day.
- Destination must be known well to avoid mis-teleportation.
- Activation is mental; may carry willing passengers in contact.
- Misuse or poor knowledge of the location may result in error.

magic_items.name: Helm of Underwater Action
magic_items.description:
This magical helm enables the wearer to breathe and see underwater:

- Grants continuous underwater breathing.
- Provides clear sight underwater as if in daylight.
- Allows wearer to speak clearly underwater.
- Essential for deep-sea exploration or aquatic adventuring.

magic_items.name: Alchemy Jug
magic_items.description:
This magical jug can pour out various liquids upon command:

- Produces a fixed amount of one selected liquid per day (e.g., water, wine, vinegar, oil).
- Quantity and type determined by command word.
- Cannot produce multiple liquids in the same day.
- Useful for survival, travel, or trade.

magic_items.name: Bag of Beans
magic_items.description:
This bag contains 3d4 magical beans. If a bean is removed and planted, strange things happen:

- Growth may cause explosions, monster summoning, treasure, or dungeon entrances.
- Each bean causes a different magical effect (DM rolls on chart).
- Beans are volatile and planting multiple at once may have compound effects.

magic_items.name: Bag of Devouring
magic_items.description:
This cursed item resembles a *bag of holding* but is a creature that consumes stored items:

- 90% chance to consume any item placed inside.
- Living creatures are drawn in and devoured in 1d4 rounds.
- Only *wish* or *limited wish* can retrieve lost items or creatures.
- Can be detected by *detect evil* or *true seeing*.

magic_items.name: Bag of Holding
magic_items.description:
This magical bag creates an extra-dimensional space inside:

- Can hold from 250 lbs./30 cu. ft. up to 600 lbs./150 cu. ft. (type varies).
- Weight does not change regardless of contents.
- Items must fit through the opening.
- If overfilled or pierced, contents are lost in the Astral Plane.
- Combining with other extra-dimensional items (e.g., portable hole) causes explosion.

magic_items.name: Bag of Transmuting
magic_items.description:
This cursed bag appears to be a *bag of holding*, but slowly ruins stored contents:

- 5% chance per hour that items turn into worthless trash.
- Irreversible without *wish* or divine intervention.
- Cannot be detected by normal identification magic.
- Especially dangerous for storing food, potions, or valuables.

magic_items.name: Bag of Tricks
magic_items.description:
This fuzzy bag contains small cloth balls. When removed and thrown, each becomes a creature:

- Animals summoned serve for 10 minutes or until slain.
- Roll on subtable to determine animal type and quantity.
- Cannot summon more than one animal per round.
- Creatures disappear when slain or time expires.

magic_items.name: Beaker of Plentiful Potions
magic_items.description:
This flask fills itself with a random potion once per week:

- Roll on potion table to determine contents.
- Liquid cannot be removed and stored; must be consumed directly.
- Flask reseals itself after one dose is used.
- Excess use has no additional effect until recharge completes.

magic_items.name: Bucknard's Everfull Purse
magic_items.description:
This small purse generates a steady trickle of coinage:

- Produces 1d4×10 gold pieces per day.
- Coins disappear after 24 hours unless spent.
- Attempts to hoard or trade the purse itself cause it to stop working.

magic_items.name: Decanter of Endless Water
magic_items.description:
This stoppered bottle pours fresh water when commanded:

- Modes include: stream, fountain, and geyser.
- Geyser can knock down creatures (save vs. breath weapon).
- Produces up to 30 gallons per round.
- Functions up to 3 times/day.

magic_items.name: Efreeti Bottle
magic_items.description:
This ornate bottle contains a bound efreeti:

- 90% chance the efreeti obeys 3 commands before disappearing.
- 10% chance it escapes and attacks or causes mischief.
- Bottle functions only once.
- Commands must be clear and within reason.

magic_items.name: Eversmoking Bottle
magic_items.description:
This bottle releases a thick, obscuring smoke when opened:

- Smoke expands 10 feet per round to 100-ft. radius.
- Wind disperses smoke normally.
- Functions once per day.
- Re-stoppering the bottle stops the effect immediately.

magic_items.name: Flask of Curses
magic_items.description:
This cursed flask appears magical, but upon opening releases a powerful curse:

- All within 30 feet must save vs. spell or suffer a random curse.
- Effects may include silence, blindness, or bad luck.
- Flask becomes inert afterward.
- Can be detected with *true seeing* or *identify* (25% chance).

magic_items.name: Heward's Handy Haversack
magic_items.description:
This backpack acts as a mini *bag of holding* with perfect item retrieval:

- Weighs only 5 lbs. regardless of contents.
- Holds up to 120 lbs. or 20 cubic feet.
- Items are always on top and easily retrieved.
- Includes two side pouches (20 lbs. each).

magic_items.name: Iron Flask
magic_items.description:
This magical container is used to trap extraplanar creatures:

- Traps one creature when name is spoken during uncorking.
- Once captured, the creature remains trapped until released.
- Upon release, 75% chance it obeys one command (save negates).
- Only one creature at a time may be contained.

magic_items.name: Portable Hole
magic_items.description:
This silk cloth creates a 6-foot deep extradimensional space when unfolded:

- Opens into a circular hole (6 ft. diameter).
- Can be picked up to close instantly.
- If placed inside a *bag of holding*, both are lost in an explosion.
- Usable to conceal items or provide emergency shelter.

magic_items.name: Pouch of Accessibility
magic_items.description:
This magical pouch makes all items stored within instantly accessible:

- Wearer can retrieve any item as if it were on top.
- Functions for up to 20 lbs. or 2 cubic feet of contents.
- Reduces need to fumble in combat or during emergencies.

magic_items.name: Candle of Invocation
magic_items.description:
This magical candle enhances the spellcasting ability of priests:

- When burned, grants +2 levels of spellcasting ability to priests of the same alignment.
- Enables use of higher-level spells (if known).
- Burning the candle while casting a summoning spell increases success chance by 50%.
- Only functions once; burns for 4 hours total.
- Must match alignment to gain benefits.

magic_items.name: Dust of Appearance
magic_items.description:
This fine powder makes all invisible creatures and objects visible:

- Covers a 10-ft cube when thrown.
- Also reveals hidden doors, illusions, and creatures on the Ethereal Plane.
- Causes -2 penalty to enemy attacks and saves due to glowing effect.
- Lasts 5d10 rounds; usable once per packet.
- Affects airborne targets as well as grounded.

magic_items.name: Dust of Disappearance
magic_items.description:
When this dust is thrown or inhaled, it renders creatures invisible:

- Affects all creatures in a 10-ft cube.
- Grants invisibility as the spell (*invisible* until attack or spell use).
- Duration: 2d6 turns.
- Each packet is single-use.
- Does not prevent detection by see invisible or similar magic.

magic_items.name: Dust of Dryness
magic_items.description:
This magical dust absorbs water rapidly:

- One pellet can absorb up to 100 gallons of water.
- Creates a marble-sized pellet that can later release the water.
- Useful for crossing rivers, draining pools, or water storage.
- Can be used offensively on water elementals.
- Each packet contains 5–8 pellets.

magic_items.name: Dust of Illusion
magic_items.description:
This fine powder alters the appearance of the creature it touches:

- Grants illusionary disguise, like the *change self* spell.
- Duration: 1d6+6 turns.
- Can change size, gender, race, clothing appearance, etc.
- Does not alter voice, scent, or physical interaction.

magic_items.name: Dust of Tracelessness
magic_items.description:
This powder erases any physical trace of passage:

- Removes footprints, scent trails, drag marks, and more.
- Covers a 50-foot trail or 100 sq. feet of area.
- Cannot be detected by normal or magical tracking methods.
- Often used by spies, fugitives, or wilderness scouts.

magic_items.name: Dust of Sneezing and Choking
magic_items.description:
This cursed dust causes debilitating sneezing and choking fits:

- All creatures within 20 feet must save vs. poison or fall helpless for 5d4 rounds.
- Even on a successful save, creature is slowed and distracted.
- Has no effect on undead or creatures without respiration.
- Often mistaken for dust of appearance.

magic_items.name: Incense of Meditation
magic_items.description:
This incense enhances divine spellcasting:

- Must be burned for 1 hour during prayer.
- Grants +1 level of spell effect to all spells cast within the next 24 hours.
- Only affects priests of the same alignment as the incense.
- Each box contains enough for one use.

magic_items.name: Incense of Obsession
magic_items.description:
This cursed incense appears beneficial but causes obsession:

- User becomes convinced their spells are enhanced when they are not.
- Must save vs. spell or refuse to use other magic items.
- Continues to use incense obsessively until *remove curse* is applied.

magic_items.name: Ioun Stones
magic_items.description:
These magical stones float around the user's head, granting various effects:

- Effects include regeneration, AC improvement, spell storage, and ability score boosts.
- Only one of each type can be used at a time.
- Stones orbit and glow faintly while in use.
- If targeted, they can be destroyed (AC -4, 10 hp).

magic_items.name: Keoghtom's Ointment
magic_items.description:
This small jar contains a thick magical salve:

- Heals 1d8+5 hit points per dose.
- Also cures disease and neutralizes poison.
- One jar contains 1d4+4 doses.
- Can be applied externally or ingested.

magic_items.name: Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments
magic_items.description:
These enchanted paints allow drawings to become real:

- Can create non-magical inanimate objects up to 1,000 gp in value.
- Painting must be completed to full detail over 10 minutes.
- Cannot create living creatures or magical items.
- One pot covers 1,000 cubic feet of material.

magic_items.name: Philosopher's Stone
magic_items.description:
This rare magical item allows transmutation of metals:

- Turns up to 1,000 gp worth of base metal into gold once per day.
- Can be used by alchemists to brew potions at half cost.
- Extremely rare and highly sought after.

magic_items.name: Smoke Powder
magic_items.description:
This dangerous alchemical substance is used as fuel for firearms and bombs:

- Explosive when ignited in bulk.
- Can power primitive guns or special wands.
- Highly volatile and tightly regulated by wizards’ guilds.
- Not truly magical, but treated as such for rarity and value.

magic_items.name: Sovereign Glue
magic_items.description:
This adhesive is one of the strongest known magical substances:

- Permanently bonds any two surfaces it touches.
- Only *universal solvent*, *wish*, or *limited wish* can unbind.
- One container holds enough for 1 square foot of surface.
- Comes with special applicator and protective seals.

magic_items.name: Stone of Controlling Earth Elementals
magic_items.description:
This enchanted stone grants command over summoned earth elementals:

- Enables perfect control of any elemental summoned by the bearer.
- If stone is lost, the elemental goes berserk.
- Does not summon elementals itself—used only for control.

magic_items.name: Stone of Good Luck (Luckstone)
magic_items.description:
This smooth stone grants minor magical luck:

- +1 bonus to all saving throws, ability checks, and proficiency checks.
- Must be carried to function.
- Effects are constant until the stone is lost or removed.

magic_items.name: Stone of Weight (Loadstone)
magic_items.description:
This cursed stone appears magical but has detrimental effects:

- Doubles the weight of carried gear while held.
- Reduces movement by half.
- Cannot be discarded without a *remove curse* spell.

magic_items.name: Universal Solvent
magic_items.description:
This powerful liquid dissolves even the strongest magical adhesives:

- Instantly negates *sovereign glue* and similar substances.
- One vial treats a 1-square-foot area.
- Stored in a wax-sealed lead container to prevent accidents.

magic_items.name: Brazier Commanding Fire Elementals
magic_items.description:
This magical brazier summons and controls fire elementals:

- Requires burning a large fire and casting *conjure fire elemental* spell.
- Grants perfect control over the summoned elemental.
- If interrupted, the elemental may go berserk.
- Can be used once per day.

magic_items.name: Brazier of Sleep Smoke
magic_items.description:
This cursed brazier emits a powerful narcotic smoke:

- Anyone within 30 feet must save vs. poison or fall asleep for 1d4 hours.
- Sleep is magical and cannot be broken by normal noise.
- No effect on undead or constructs.
- Appears identical to a brazier commanding fire elementals.

magic_items.name: Broom of Animated Attack
magic_items.description:
This cursed item appears to be a *broom of flying*:

- When grasped, animates and attacks the wielder.
- Attacks as a 6 HD monster with two attacks per round.
- AC 3; 18 hp; strikes for 1d6 damage.
- Can be destroyed or pacified by *remove curse*.

magic_items.name: Broom of Flying
magic_items.description:
This broom allows its user to fly at a movement rate of 18 (MC Class C):

- Carries up to 200 lbs.
- Follows mental or verbal commands.
- Can hover, bank, and change direction quickly.
- Folds for easy transport and concealment.

magic_items.name: Carpet of Flying
magic_items.description:
This ornate carpet transports passengers through the air:

- Movement rate varies by size (up to 24).
- Capacity ranges from 400–800 lbs.
- Responds to verbal commands.
- May carry multiple passengers simultaneously.

magic_items.name: Mattock of the Titans
magic_items.description:
This enormous digging tool is usable only by giants or characters with 21+ Strength:

- Functions as a +3 weapon.
- Destroys stone, dirt, or wood with a single blow.
- Can break open most dungeon walls, gates, or heavy doors.
- Too massive for standard humanoid use.

magic_items.name: Maul of the Titans
magic_items.description:
This giant-sized sledgehammer requires a Strength of 18/00 to use:

- Acts as a +2 weapon that deals double damage to structures.
- Can shatter stone, metal, or magical barriers.
- Often used by siege engineers or titan-blooded champions.

magic_items.name: Mirror of Life Trapping
magic_items.description:
This 4-ft-tall mirror traps the soul of any creature reflected in its surface:

- Contains 15 compartments that each hold one creature.
- Save vs. spell or soul is trapped within.
- Contents can be released by command or destruction.
- A trapped creature is unconscious and cannot be contacted.

magic_items.name: Mirror of Mental Prowess
magic_items.description:
This mirror grants several mental powers to the viewer:

- Acts as *clairvoyance*, *clairaudience*, and *ESP*.
- Can be used to view distant places, read minds, or open portals to seen locations.
- Powerful but vulnerable to scrying backlash or discovery.

magic_items.name: Mirror of Opposition
magic_items.description:
This cursed mirror creates a hostile duplicate of anyone who views their reflection:

- The duplicate has identical stats, gear, and knowledge.
- The double seeks to destroy the original.
- Vanishes if killed or if the mirror is destroyed.
- Dangerous if multiple party members gaze at once.

magic_items.name: Murlynd's Spoon
magic_items.description:
This wooden spoon fills an empty bowl or cup with a thick, bland gruel:

- Provides all necessary nutrients.
- Each use sustains one creature per day.
- Flavorless but nourishing.
- Refills any container once per round.

magic_items.name: Rope of Climbing
magic_items.description:
This 60-foot rope moves and secures itself on command:

- Attaches to surfaces, ties knots, or unties itself.
- Supports up to 3,000 pounds.
- Moves at 10 feet per round.
- Highly durable and resistant to magical damage.

magic_items.name: Rope of Constriction
magic_items.description:
This cursed rope acts like a rope of climbing but turns on its user:

- Attempts to entangle the holder or nearest creature.
- Grapples as a 6 HD monster.
- AC 4; 20 hp; 18 Strength for holding.
- Requires *remove curse* to stop or control.

magic_items.name: Rope of Entanglement
magic_items.description:
This magical rope lashes out to bind creatures:

- 30-foot range; targets within must save vs. spells or be entangled.
- AC 2; 12 hp; resists all but fire and acid.
- Can entangle one large or two man-sized creatures.
- Controlled mentally by the user.

magic_items.name: Rug of Smothering
magic_items.description:
This cursed rug attacks any creature that steps on it:

- Wraps around victim and attempts to suffocate them.
- Attacks as a 5 HD creature; damage 2d4 per round.
- Can only be removed by destruction or *remove curse*.

magic_items.name: Rug of Welcome
magic_items.description:
This animated rug provides hospitality and protection:

- Greets guests, cleans footwear, and detects alignment.
- +2 bonus to reaction rolls from neutral or good creatures.
- May attack hostile intruders (as 3 HD monster).
- Serves as both guard and valet.

magic_items.name: Saw of Mighty Cutting
magic_items.description:
This enchanted two-man saw cuts through almost any material:

- Cuts through 1 ft. of wood per round or 1 inch of stone.
- Requires two users or animated assistance.
- Useful for quick demolition or escape.

magic_items.name: Spade of Colossal Excavation
magic_items.description:
This magical spade digs through earth and stone effortlessly:

- Doubles normal digging rate.
- Digs through magical earth barriers.
- Does not fatigue the user.
- Favored by dwarves, miners, and grave robbers.

magic_items.name: Chime of Interruption
magic_items.description:
This magical chime disrupts spellcasting:

- When struck, all spellcasters within 30 feet must save vs. spell or lose concentration.
- Also negates ongoing magical effects within range.
- Can be used 1d6+6 times before becoming inert.
- Useful for ambushing enemy spellcasters or interrupting rituals.

magic_items.name: Chime of Opening
magic_items.description:
This chime can open locked or magically held doors and chests:

- Ringing the chime acts as a *knock* spell.
- Each chime has 1d10+10 uses.
- Effective against mundane and magical locks.
- Ineffective against wizard locks above 6th level.

magic_items.name: Chime of Hunger
magic_items.description:
This cursed chime causes ravenous hunger in those who hear it:

- Listeners must save vs. spell or stop all activity to eat.
- Lasts 2d6 turns; victims will consume anything edible.
- No saving throw allowed if already hungry or starving.
- Cannot be reversed by normal magic; requires *remove curse*.

magic_items.name: Drums of Deafening
magic_items.description:
These cursed drums deafen all within a 30-foot radius when played:

- Victims must save vs. spell or suffer deafness for 1d4 days.
- Affected characters cannot cast spells with verbal components.
- Drumbeats are thunderously loud and cannot be silenced.
- Appears identical to beneficial drums of panic.

magic_items.name: Drums of Panic
magic_items.description:
These enchanted drums cause fear in enemies and courage in allies:

- All enemies within 60 feet must save vs. spell or flee in panic.
- Allies gain +1 to attack rolls and saving throws while drums play.
- Effect lasts as long as drumming continues (up to 10 rounds/day).
- Must be played by a bard, warrior, or priest.

magic_items.name: Harp of Charming
magic_items.description:
This ornate harp casts charm effects on listeners:

- Each performance mimics a *charm person* spell.
- Affects up to 3 creatures per use; save negates.
- Can be played 3 times per day.
- Popular among bards and court musicians.

magic_items.name: Harp of Discord
magic_items.description:
This cursed harp causes confusion and dissonance:

- Creatures within 30 feet must save vs. spell or attack allies for 1d6 rounds.
- Spellcasters have a 25% chance of spell failure during the effect.
- Identical in appearance to a *harp of charming*.
- Can only be countered by *dispel magic* or *remove curse*.

magic_items.name: Horn of Blasting
magic_items.description:
This powerful horn emits a sonic blast:

- 30-foot cone; creatures take 5d6 damage (save for half).
- Structures take 100 points of structural damage.
- 1 in 10 chance the horn cracks after each use.
- Can be used once per turn.

magic_items.name: Horn of Bubbles
magic_items.description:
This whimsical horn produces harmless bubbles when sounded:

- No magical effect; merely a trick item.
- Emits bubbles in a 30-foot stream.
- Amuses or distracts low-intelligence creatures.
- Sometimes used as a decoy.

magic_items.name: Horn of Collapsing
magic_items.description:
This magical horn weakens structures:

- When blown at a wall or ceiling, causes a 20-foot radius collapse (save vs. crushing).
- Works only on earthen or stone construction.
- 1 in 6 chance of backfiring, collapsing area on user.
- Only usable once per day.

magic_items.name: Horn of Fog
magic_items.description:
This horn generates a dense fog when blown:

- Fog expands in a 60-foot radius, obscuring all sight.
- Wind disperses fog normally.
- Can be used 3 times per day.
- Used for cover, escapes, or ambushes.

magic_items.name: Horn of Goodness (Evil)
magic_items.description:
This horn affects creatures based on their alignment:

- Good-aligned version harms evil creatures (2d6 damage, save for half).
- Evil-aligned version harms good creatures.
- Radius: 10 feet; usable once per round.
- Neutral creatures unaffected.

magic_items.name: Horn of the Tritons
magic_items.description:
This conch-like horn controls aquatic creatures:

- Calms hostile sea creatures (save negates).
- Summons 5d4 hippocampi, sea lions, or giant sea horses.
- Grants water breathing to the user for 1 hour/day.
- Only usable by priests or warriors.

magic_items.name: Horn of Valhalla
magic_items.description:
This horn summons berserkers to fight for the user:

- Summons 2d4+2 warriors who obey for 1 hour or until slain.
- Type and strength of warriors depend on horn variety.
- Usable once per week.
- Improper use may cause summoned berserkers to attack the user.

magic_items.name: Lyre of Building
magic_items.description:
This magical lyre strengthens structures and repels siege damage:

- Prevents collapse, magical erosion, or siege destruction.
- If played for 30 minutes, repairs 1d100 square feet of wall or building.
- Can be used once per day.
- Favored by dwarves, builders, and defenders.

magic_items.name: Pipes of Haunting
magic_items.description:
These pipes emit a ghostly sound that causes fear:

- Affects all creatures within 30 feet (save vs. spell or flee).
- Only usable by bards or thieves.
- May be used 2 times per day.
- Ineffective against undead or mindless creatures.

magic_items.name: Pipes of Pain
magic_items.description:
These cursed pipes cause pain to the player and audience:

- Player must save vs. spell or suffer 1d6 damage per round.
- All listeners within 60 feet must save or suffer -1 to attack and morale.
- Continues as long as playing persists.
- Resembles *pipes of haunting* in appearance.

magic_items.name: Pipes of Sounding
magic_items.description:
These pipes mimic a variety of loud or dramatic sounds:

- May sound horns, fanfares, thunder, or screams.
