- Illusory sound used to confuse or distract enemies.
- Usable 3 times per day.
- Often used in theatrical performances or tricks.

magic_items.name: Pipes of the Sewers
magic_items.description:
These magical pipes summon and control rats:

- Summons 2d6 giant rats within 100 feet.
- Obey the player for up to 10 rounds.
- Usable once per day.
- Popular among thieves’ guilds and urban adventurers.

magic_items.name: Apparatus of Kwalish
magic_items.description:
This large, sealed iron barrel transforms into a mechanical vehicle:

- Can operate on land or underwater.
- Carries up to two Medium-sized creatures.
- Functions as a heavily armored tank or submarine.
- Controlled from within via levers (12 total).
- Includes pincers, periscope, and propulsion.
- AC 2; 60 hp; speed 3 (land) or 6 (water).
- Extremely rare and often found in ancient ruins.

magic_items.name: Boat, Folding
magic_items.description:
This wooden box can unfold into various watercraft:

- Box form: 4 in. × 2 in. × 1 in.
- Folds into: a small boat (10 ft. long, holds 4) or a longboat (24 ft., holds 15).
- Can transform between forms 3 times/day.
- Weighs 50 lbs. in box form.
- Extremely durable and buoyant.

magic_items.name: Bowl Commanding Water Elementals
magic_items.description:
This magical bowl allows the user to summon and control water elementals:

- Fill with water and cast *conjure water elemental*.
- Grants perfect control over the elemental.
- Can be used once per day.
- Elemental becomes hostile if bowl is removed or destroyed.

magic_items.name: Bowl of Watery Death
magic_items.description:
This cursed bowl appears as a bowl commanding water elementals:

- Summons a hostile water elemental that attacks the user.
- Elemental cannot be banished or controlled.
- Disguised perfectly unless *true seeing* is used.
- Requires *remove curse* to discard.

magic_items.name: Censer Controlling Air Elementals
magic_items.description:
This incense censer grants control over air elementals:

- Must be used in conjunction with *conjure air elemental* spell.
- Grants perfect control of the summoned creature.
- Functions once per day.
- Only effective while the censer is actively burning incense.

magic_items.name: Censer of Summoning Hostile Air Elementals
magic_items.description:
This cursed item mimics a *censer controlling air elementals*:

- Summons a 16 HD hostile air elemental.
- Attacks immediately; cannot be controlled or banished easily.
- Cursed item cannot be discarded without *remove curse*.
- Often found in treasure hoards meant to trap intruders.

magic_items.name: Crystal Ball
magic_items.description:
This scrying device allows remote viewing:

- Functions as the *clairvoyance* spell.
- May include powers like *ESP*, *telepathy*, or *true seeing* depending on type.
- Subject can save vs. spell to resist being observed.
- Fatiguing if used more than three times per day.

magic_items.name: Crystal Hypnosis Ball
magic_items.description:
This cursed version of a crystal ball hypnotizes the viewer:

- Viewer must save vs. spell or be charmed by the nearest creature.
- Charmed state lasts 1d6 days unless dispelled.
- No warning or indication of the item's nature.
- Requires *remove curse* to break attachment.

magic_items.name: Cube of Force
magic_items.description:
This small cube creates an invisible barrier when activated:

- Six different fields, selectable by pressing faces.
- Options include: repelling gas, liquids, missiles, creatures, magic, or all.
- Duration based on charges (36 total).
- Rechargeable only by magical means.

magic_items.name: Cube of Frost Resistance
magic_items.description:
This cube grants protection from cold and freezing attacks:

- Aura extends 10 feet from user.
- Reduces cold damage by 50% to all in area.
- Charges deplete with exposure to magical cold.
- 18 total charges; functions until depleted.

magic_items.name: Cubic Gate
magic_items.description:
This cube has six faces, each tied to a different plane:

- Pressing a face opens a gate to its corresponding plane.
- Can transport beings or summon denizens.
- Use requires care—may summon hostile extraplanar creatures.
- Limited number of uses before recharge is required.

magic_items.name: Daern's Instant Fortress
magic_items.description:
This small metal cube expands into a 20-foot square tower upon command:

- Takes 1 round to grow into a fortress with battlements and arrow slits.
- AC 3; 100 hp; immune to most physical attacks.
- Entrance opens only to command word.
- Returns to cube form in 1 round when commanded.
- Usable once per day.

magic_items.name: Deck of Illusions
magic_items.description:
This deck of cards creates realistic illusions when thrown:

- Each card produces an illusion based on its image.
- Illusions are convincing, including sound and motion.
- Illusions last until dispelled or disbelieved.
- Deck usually contains 34 cards (DM rolls).
- One card may be used per round.

magic_items.name: Deck of Many Things
magic_items.description:
This dangerous magical deck grants powerful boons or banes:

- Each card drawn invokes a specific, often dramatic effect.
- Some grant wishes, treasure, or stat boosts.
- Others cause death, imprisonment, or loss of soul.
- Drawing is irrevocable; number of draws must be declared in advance.
- Deck typically contains 13 or 22 cards (DM decides).

magic_items.name: Eyes of Charming
magic_items.description:
These magical lenses allow the user to charm others by gaze:

- Functions like *charm person* (save vs. spell negates).
- Must maintain eye contact for 1 full round.
- Charges are limited to 3/day.
- Effective only on humanoids with sight.

magic_items.name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
magic_items.description:
These lenses allow close-up inspection of small objects:

- Grants +1 bonus to detect traps, secret doors, or flaws in workmanship.
- Effective within 1 foot of the surface.
- Used by thieves, gemcutters, and artificers.
- No magical detection—purely visual enhancement.

magic_items.name: Eyes of Petrification
magic_items.description:
These cursed lenses function like a medusa’s gaze:

- Viewer must save vs. petrification or be turned to stone.
- First use targets the wearer.
- Cannot be removed without *remove curse*.
- Victims remain petrified until *stone to flesh* is used.

magic_items.name: Eyes of the Eagle
magic_items.description:
These magical lenses enhance long-distance vision:

- Viewer can spot creatures and objects at double normal range.
- Grants +1 bonus to surprise checks.
- Favored by rangers, scouts, and snipers.

magic_items.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power
magic_items.description:
These small statuettes transform into magical animals or beasts:

- Each figure summons a specific creature.
- Duration and frequency of use varies by figurine.
- Creatures are loyal to the summoner and may fight or scout.
- Damage to creature may damage the figurine.

magic_items.name: Horseshoes of a Zephyr
magic_items.description:
These enchanted horseshoes allow the mount to gallop over any surface:

- Travel across water, mud, snow, or vertical surfaces.
- No penalty for rough or hazardous terrain.
- Usable on any normal or magical horse.
- Mount leaves no tracks or scent.

magic_items.name: Horseshoes of Speed
magic_items.description:
These magical horseshoes increase a horse's movement rate:

- Adds +12 to base movement rate.
- Also improves initiative when mounted.
- Shoes must be nailed in place to function.

magic_items.name: Iron Bands of Bilarro
magic_items.description:
This sphere releases magical bands that entangle a target:

- Thrown up to 30 feet.
- Target must save vs. spell or be bound and immobile.
- Bands can only be broken by great strength or magic.
- Usable once per day.

magic_items.name: Lens of Detection
magic_items.description:
This magnifying glass grants enhanced perception:

- +1 bonus to finding secret doors, traps, or illusions.
- Held up to the eye to activate.
- Only functions for 10 minutes/day total.
- Used by thieves and scouts.

magic_items.name: Quaal's Feather Token
magic_items.description:
Each token creates a magical item or effect once per use:

- Common types: tree, bird, whip, fan, swan boat, anchor.
- Used by throwing or placing on a surface.
- Each token is single-use only.
- Versatile and lightweight utility magic.

magic_items.name: Quiver of Ehlonna
magic_items.description:
This magical quiver stores many projectiles or weapons:

- Holds up to 60 arrows, 18 javelins, or 6 long items.
- Weight remains unchanged regardless of contents.
- Drawn items always appear on top.
- Popular among rangers and archers.

magic_items.name: Sheet of Smallness
magic_items.description:
This enchanted silk square shrinks items for easy storage:

- Place on object and speak command word.
- Object shrinks to 1/12th original size and weight.
- Returns to full size when shaken out.
- Only works on non-living items up to 1,000 lbs.

magic_items.name: Sphere of Annihilation
magic_items.description:
This black sphere destroys anything it touches:

- 2-foot diameter globe of absolute darkness.
- Obliterates all matter, magical or mundane.
- Controlled via mental command (Intelligence check required).
- Mishandling may destroy the user.
- Rare artifact-level item.

magic_items.name: Stone Horse
magic_items.description:
This statue becomes a living magical steed when activated:

- Types include: granite, basalt, or marble steeds.
- May have special powers such as flight or tirelessness.
- Transforms into horse form with a command word.
- Can revert to stone for storage.

magic_items.name: Well of Many Worlds
magic_items.description:
This cloth opens a planar portal when unfurled:

- Leads to a random or predetermined alternate plane.
- Objects and creatures can pass freely.
- Portal remains open for 1 turn or until dismissed.
- Use with caution—destination is not always safe.

magic_items.name: Wind Fan
magic_items.description:
This magical folding fan creates a powerful gust of wind:

- Functions like the *gust of wind* spell.
- Can be used once per round, 3/day.
- 1 in 20 chance per use to tear and become nonmagical.
- Commonly used by sailors, monks, and spellcasters.

magic_items.name: Wings of Flying
magic_items.description:
These gossamer wings allow the wearer to fly:

- Flight speed 18, maneuverability class B.
- Usable for up to 1 hour/day.
- Attached as a cloak or harness.
- Cannot be worn with heavy armor.

magic_items.name: Armor of Command
magic_items.description:
This armor grants the wearer impressive presence on the battlefield:

- Allies within 30 feet gain a +1 bonus to morale.
- Enemies suffer a -1 penalty to morale and saving throws.
- Functions only when worn by a character with Charisma 15 or higher.
- Comes in any armor type and is usually +1 enchanted.

magic_items.name: Armor of Blending
magic_items.description:
This armor allows the wearer to blend into surroundings:

- Wearer can become invisible at will (as *invisibility* spell).
- Invisibility is broken when attacking or casting spells.
- Activating ability requires a command word.
- Comes in any armor type, often leather or chain.

magic_items.name: Armor of Missile Attraction
magic_items.description:
This cursed armor draws missile attacks toward the wearer:

- Wearer becomes the primary target of all ranged attacks in combat.
- Magical and non-magical missiles automatically seek the wearer.
- Armor is typically +1 or better but functions as a -1 AC penalty overall.
- Cannot be removed without *remove curse*.

magic_items.name: Armor of Rage
magic_items.description:
This cursed armor causes uncontrollable battle fury:

- Wearer flies into a berserk rage when combat begins.
- Cannot distinguish friend from foe; attacks nearest target.
- Rage lasts for 1d4+1 rounds or until no enemies remain.
- Cannot be removed without *remove curse*.

magic_items.name: Elven Chain Mail
magic_items.description:
This finely wrought chain mail is light and flexible:

- Does not encumber spellcasting for elves and half-elves.
- Provides AC equivalent to normal chain mail (+5 base).
- Often enchanted to +1 or higher.
- Rarely available to non-elves unless gifted or found.

magic_items.name: Plate Mail of Etherealness
magic_items.description:
This enchanted plate mail allows the wearer to become ethereal:

- Usable once per day for up to 1 hour.
- Functions like the *etherealness* spell.
- Armor appears misty when ability is active.
- Extremely rare and valuable.

magic_items.name: Plate Mail of Fear
magic_items.description:
This sinister armor inspires terror in enemies:

- Enemies within 15 feet must save vs. spell or flee for 1d4 rounds.
- Activates automatically when wearer is attacked.
- May be deactivated with a command word.
- Usually +1 or +2 plate mail.

magic_items.name: Plate Mail of Vulnerability
magic_items.description:
This cursed armor reduces the wearer's resistance to attacks:

- Wearer suffers -1 penalty to AC and saving throws.
- Opponents gain +1 to hit against the wearer.
- Cannot be removed except by *remove curse*.
- Often disguised as plate mail +1 or +2.

magic_items.name: Shield, Large, +1, +4 vs. Missiles
magic_items.description:
This large shield grants +1 AC normally and +4 vs. missile attacks:

- Provides strong defense against ranged weapons.
- Effects apply even if wielder is unaware of attacker.
- Counts as a +1 shield for all other purposes.

magic_items.name: Shield -1, Missile Attractor
magic_items.description:
This cursed shield provides poor protection and draws missile fire:

- Reduces AC by 1 (functions as -1 shield).
- Draws missile attacks from all enemies in range.
- Cannot be discarded or exchanged without *remove curse*.
- Often found among otherwise mundane treasure.

magic_items.name: Arrow of Direction
magic_items.description:
This magical arrow always points in the direction chosen by the user:

- When laid flat or spun, it turns to indicate the selected direction.
- Useful for navigation in dungeons or wilderness.
- Works once per turn; requires concentration.
- Not consumed when used, but cannot be fired as a weapon.

magic_items.name: Arrow of Slaying
magic_items.description:
This enchanted arrow instantly kills a specific type of creature:

- Must be matched to a creature type (e.g., dragon, undead).
- Target must save vs. death magic or die instantly.
- Functions only once; destroyed on use.
- Missed attacks have no effect.

magic_items.name: Axe +2, Throwing
magic_items.description:
This hand axe returns to the thrower’s hand after being hurled:

- Acts as a +2 weapon in melee and ranged combat.
- Returns at the end of the round automatically.
- Range: 30/60/90 feet.
- Only functions for warriors and dwarves.

magic_items.name: Bow +1
magic_items.description:
This bow grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls:

- Compatible with magical and non-magical arrows.
- May be long or short bow.
- Arrows fired from this bow are considered magical for purposes of overcoming resistance.

magic_items.name: Crossbow of Accuracy +3
magic_items.description:
This heavy crossbow grants exceptional precision:

- +3 bonus to attack rolls only.
- No bonus to damage.
- Range categories unchanged.
- Favored by assassins and sharpshooters.

magic_items.name: Crossbow of Distance
magic_items.description:
This magical crossbow doubles the range of any bolt fired:

- No penalty for long-range shots.
- May be combined with other enchantments.
- Range categories are doubled.
- Useful for siege defense or sniping.

magic_items.name: Crossbow of Speed
magic_items.description:
This enchanted crossbow allows rapid fire:

- Fires twice per round instead of once.
- No penalty for the second shot.
- Must be reloaded magically (reload is free action).
- Very rare and often restricted.

magic_items.name: Dagger +1, +2 vs. Tiny or Small creatures
magic_items.description:
This magical dagger provides:

- +1 bonus to attack and damage normally.
- +2 bonus when used against Tiny or Small creatures (e.g., kobolds, goblins).
- Effective for concealed or off-hand use.

magic_items.name: Dagger +2, +3 vs. larger than man-sized
magic_items.description:
This enchanted dagger provides:

- +2 bonus to attack and damage normally.
- +3 bonus when attacking creatures larger than man-sized (e.g., ogres, trolls).
- Easily concealed and often used as a backup weapon.

magic_items.name: Dagger +2, Longtooth
magic_items.description:
This dagger has an elongated blade and enhanced critical potential:

- +2 to hit and damage.
- On a natural 20, causes double damage.
- Can be used for backstabbing (with thief multiplier).
- Considered magical for all purposes.

magic_items.name: Dagger of Throwing
magic_items.description:
This dagger is perfectly balanced for ranged use:

- +2 bonus when thrown, +1 in melee.
- Returns to the thrower’s hand at the beginning of the next round.
- Range: 20/40/60 feet.
- Favored by rogues and assassins.

magic_items.name: Dagger of Venom
magic_items.description:
This enchanted dagger delivers a potent poison:

- +1 weapon.
- Once per day, can inject poison on a successful hit.
- Target must save vs. poison or die.
- Venom replenishes at dawn.

magic_items.name: Dart of Homing
magic_items.description:
This dart magically seeks its target:

- +4 to hit regardless of range.
- Hits even invisible or concealed targets (if general location is known).
- Destroyed upon impact.
- Rarely found in multiples.

magic_items.name: Hammer +3, Dwarven Thrower
magic_items.description:
This warhammer functions as a +3 weapon:

- Returns when thrown by a dwarf.
- Deals double damage vs. giants.
- Grants +1 bonus to Strength while held (dwarves only).
- Revered relic among dwarf clans.

magic_items.name: Hammer of Thunderbolts
magic_items.description:
This massive hammer requires special conditions to wield fully:

- Functions as +3 weapon.
- If wielder wears a Belt of Giant Strength and Gauntlets of Ogre Power:
   - Causes thunderclap on hit (100-ft. radius, stun effect).
- Wieldable only by warriors.
- Can be thrown up to 90 ft. and returns.

magic_items.name: Hornblade
magic_items.description:
This short sword is formed of enchanted horn:

- +1 weapon; lightweight and flexible.
- Grants a +2 bonus to initiative when used.
- May be concealed as a wand or rod.
- Especially common among fey.

magic_items.name: Javelin of Lightning
magic_items.description:
This weapon transforms into a lightning bolt when thrown:

- On command, functions as *lightning bolt* spell (6d6 damage).
- Reverts to normal javelin afterward.
- May be reused, but lightning effect only once per day.
- Range: 30/60/90 feet.

magic_items.name: Javelin of Piercing
magic_items.description:
This magical javelin punches through armor with ease:

- Ignores 2 points of target’s armor class.
- +2 bonus to hit and damage.
- Excellent against heavily armored foes.
- Usable by any class that can throw javelins.

magic_items.name: Knife, Buckle
magic_items.description:
This dagger appears as a belt buckle:

- Can be drawn as a free action.
- +1 weapon, not magical in appearance.
- Common among spies and thieves.
- Often enchanted with poison resistance.

magic_items.name: Mace of Disruption
magic_items.description:
This holy weapon is especially effective against undead:

- +1 or +2 weapon.
- Undead struck must save vs. spell or be instantly destroyed.
- Does double damage to vampires, liches, and other major undead.
- Usable only by lawful good characters.

magic_items.name: Net of Entrapment
magic_items.description:
This net magically binds any creature it entangles:

- Target must save vs. paralyzation or be completely restrained.
- Net tightens magically around target.
- Only *dispel magic* or *freedom* can release victim before duration ends.
- Duration: 1d4+2 turns.

magic_items.name: Net of Snaring
magic_items.description:
This net automatically hits targets when thrown:

- Functions as +3 weapon to hit.
- Entangles target for 1d4 rounds (no save).
- Net resets itself after use.
- Cannot be used underwater.

magic_items.name: Quarterstaff, Magical
magic_items.description:
This wooden staff is enchanted to serve as a weapon:

- Typically +1, sometimes +2.
- May contain additional powers: spell storage, light, knockback, etc.
- Usable by wizards and druids.
- Often serves as a walking stick or focus.

magic_items.name: Scimitar of Speed
magic_items.description:
This enchanted blade grants the wielder increased attack speed:

- Functions as a +2 weapon.
- Allows one extra attack per round.
- Initiative modifier: +2 bonus.
- Can only be used by warriors or clerics.

magic_items.name: Sling of Seeking +2
magic_items.description:
This sling grants magical accuracy:

- +2 bonus to hit and damage.
- Ammunition fired from this sling is considered magical.
- Automatically seeks targets (ignore cover penalties).
- Can be used by any class with sling proficiency.

magic_items.name: Spear, Cursed Backbiter
magic_items.description:
This cursed spear turns on its wielder during combat:

- On a natural 1, the spear reverses direction and strikes the user.
- Damage: normal for weapon, plus surprise.
- Cannot be discarded without *remove curse*.
- Disguised as +1 spear.

magic_items.name: Trident of Fish Command
magic_items.description:
This weapon controls aquatic creatures:

- Acts as +1 trident.
- Allows use of *speak with animals (fish)* and *charm monster* (aquatic only).
- Range: 60 feet.
- 3/day command ability; duration 1 turn.

magic_items.name: Trident of Submission
magic_items.description:
This trident dominates the will of targets:

- +2 weapon.
- If target fails save vs. spells, they are charmed for 1 turn.
- Effect ends if wielder attacks or harms target again.
- Only affects humanoids and monsters of animal intelligence.

magic_items.name: Trident of Warning
magic_items.description:
This magical trident alerts the wielder to danger:

- +2 weapon.
- Emits a mental alarm when hostile creatures approach within 60 feet.
- Functions even when the wielder is asleep or unconscious.
- Grants +2 bonus to surprise checks.

magic_items.name: Trident of Yearning
magic_items.description:
This cursed weapon compels its wielder to seek the sea:

- Once held, the wielder becomes obsessed with the ocean.
- Must save vs. spell to resist urge to return to the nearest large body of water.
- Cannot discard the weapon unless *remove curse* is used.

magic_items.name: Aroma of Dreams
magic_items.description:
**Aroma of Dreams** is a sweet-smelling potion that induces deep slumber.
- Anyone who smells it must save vs. poison or fall asleep for 2d6 turns.
- Sleep is magical and cannot be disturbed by normal means.
- Useful for infiltration or sabotage missions.
This oil evaporates quickly; it must be used within 1 turn of uncorking.
This potion does not affect undead or constructs.

magic_items.name: Curdled Death
magic_items.description:
**Curdled Death** is a foul-smelling, cloudy potion of deadly effect.
- When exposed to air, it creates a 10-foot radius cloud of toxic vapor.
- All creatures in the area must save vs. poison or die instantly.
- Even on a successful save, targets suffer 1d6 damage and -2 to attack rolls for 1d4 rounds.
This potion is sometimes used as a last resort trap or assassination tool.

magic_items.name: Murdock's Insect Ward
magic_items.description:
**Murdock's Insect Ward** repels insects and insectoid monsters.
- When applied to skin or clothing, it creates a citrus-scented barrier.
- Normal insects will not approach; giant insects must save vs. poison to attack.
- Duration: 1d4+4 turns.
A favorite among jungle explorers and necromancers alike.

magic_items.name: Oil of Preservation
magic_items.description:
**Oil of Preservation** halts decay in organic matter.
- When applied to food, corpses, paper, or wood, it prevents rot for one year.
- Multiple coatings extend the duration.
Used widely by sages, tomb guardians, and taxidermists.

magic_items.name: Potion of Elemental Control
magic_items.description:
**Potion of Elemental Control** allows mastery over a specific element.
- Choose air, earth, fire, or water when brewed.
- Grants use of the *elemental control* spell (once) within 1 hour of drinking.
- No verbal or somatic component is needed.
Favored by planar travelers and elite elementalist cults.

magic_items.name: Starella's Aphrodisiac
magic_items.description:
**Starella's Aphrodisiac** causes temporary infatuation.

- Creatures within 5 ft. must save vs. spell or become enamored with the first creature they see.
- Effect lasts 1d6 turns.
- Infatuated targets protect or try to please their new love interest.
- Violence ends the effect prematurely.

Used in both mischievous pranks and court intrigues.

magic_items.name: Affliction
magic_items.description:
**Affliction** is a cursed ring that causes the wearer to suffer from a debilitating malady.

- Within 1d4 days of donning the ring, the wearer contracts a random disease or magical affliction.
- These ailments resist magical healing (only *heal* or *wish* will cure them).
- The ring cannot be removed without a *remove curse* spell.

These rings are often disguised to look like beneficial magical items.

magic_items.name: Armoring (W)
magic_items.description:
**Ring of Armoring** is designed for wizards who normally cannot wear armor.

- Provides an Armor Class of 5 (as if wearing chainmail).
- Does not interfere with spellcasting.
- Duration: 6 turns + 1 turn per level per use.
- Usable once per day.

Multiple rings do not stack, and wearing real armor deactivates the effect.

magic_items.name: Bureaucratic Wizardry (W)
magic_items.description:
**Ring of Bureaucratic Wizardry** imposes frustrating restrictions on spellcasting.

- The wearer must fill out imaginary paperwork before casting any spell.
- Each casting takes 1 additional round as the paperwork is 'completed'.
- If the process is interrupted, the spell fails.

This cursed ring cannot be removed without *remove curse* and provides no benefits.

magic_items.name: Elemental Metamorphosis
magic_items.description:
**Ring of Elemental Metamorphosis** allows the wearer to temporarily assume an elemental form.

- Choose one form when the ring is created: air, earth, fire, or water.
- Once per day, the wearer can transform into that elemental type for 1 turn.
- Grants movement, immunities, and abilities of that element (DMG p. 180).

This ring is highly sought by elementalists and adventurers who travel planar realms.

magic_items.name: Fortitude
magic_items.description:
**Ring of Fortitude** enhances the wearer's resilience to hardship.

- Grants +2 bonus to saving throws vs. poison, disease, and death magic.
- Wearer can continue to act when reduced to 0 hp (for 1d4 rounds) before collapsing.
- Does not prevent death but may give time for healing.

These rings are often found among warriors, rangers, and monster hunters.

magic_items.name: Randomness (P)
magic_items.description:
**Ring of Randomness** causes the wearer’s spells or abilities to behave unpredictably.

- Each time a priest spell is cast, roll 1d6:
  1 – Spell fails
  2 – Spell affects a random target
  3 – Spell has normal effect
  4 – Spell is maximized
  5 – Spell is reversed
  6 – Wild surge (DM’s discretion)
- Ring is cursed and cannot be removed without *remove curse*.

magic_items.name: Resistance (W)
magic_items.description:
**Ring of Resistance** shields the wearer from elemental and magical harm.

- Grants +1 bonus to all saving throws.
- Reduces elemental damage (fire, cold, lightning, acid) by 1 point per die.
- Continues to function even if the wearer is unconscious.

These rings are rare and valued by wizards and adventurers alike.

magic_items.name: Rod of Distortion
magic_items.description:
**Rod of Distortion** warps time and space around the wielder.

- 3/day: cast *dimension door*, *slow*, or *confusion*.
- 1/day: cast *disintegrate*.
- Rod emits a shimmering field that gives the wielder a +2 bonus to AC vs. missiles.

Powerful and unpredictable, this rod is often found in the hands of planar travelers.

magic_items.name: Staff of the Elements (W)
magic_items.description:
**Staff of the Elements** channels raw elemental power.

- Usable by wizards only.
- Stores 20 charges.
- Functions:
  - Fireball (1 charge)
  - Ice Storm (2 charges)
  - Gust of Wind (1 charge)
  - Stoneskin (2 charges)
- Once per day: summon an elemental (as *conjure elemental*, costs 5 charges).

The staff crackles with latent elemental energy when held.

magic_items.name: Wand of Corridors
magic_items.description:
**Wand of Corridors** reshapes dungeon passageways.

- 10 charges.
- Creates a temporary 10-ft. wide hallway through stone, earth, or wood.
- Duration: 1 turn per charge used.
- Collapses after the duration ends.

Favored by tomb robbers and delvers of ancient ruins.

magic_items.name: Wand of Element Transmogrification
magic_items.description:
**Wand of Element Transmogrification** alters one type of elemental energy into another.

- 10 charges.
- Target elemental spell (within 60 ft.) is changed to a different element:
  - Example: *fireball* becomes *iceball*, *lightning bolt* becomes *acid stream*.
- Does not change damage or area, only type.

Useful against foes with elemental resistances.

magic_items.name: Wand of Misplaced Objects
magic_items.description:
**Wand of Misplaced Objects** relocates unattended items.

- 15 charges.
- Range: 120 ft.
- Teleports one unattended non-magical item (up to 25 lbs.) to a location the user can see.
- Cost: 1–3 charges depending on distance and weight.

Used to steal from afar or recover dropped tools during battle.

magic_items.name: Wand of Prime Material Pocket
magic_items.description:
**Wand of Prime Material Pocket** opens a tiny interdimensional space.

- 5 charges.
- Creates a 5 ft. × 5 ft. × 5 ft. extradimensional pocket on the Prime Material Plane.
- Lasts 1 hour per charge used.
- Can store living beings, objects, or even spell effects.

Highly unstable if pierced or dispelled prematurely.

magic_items.name: Manual of Dogmatic Methods
magic_items.description:
**Manual of Dogmatic Methods** is a cursed tome disguised as a religious instructional text.

- When read, the book subtly rewrites the priest's beliefs and dogma over the course of 1d4 days.
- The reader must save vs. spell or become fanatically devoted to a new philosophy or false deity.
- All priest spells become reversed or perverted in purpose.
- The effect is permanent unless *remove curse* or *wish* is used.

This manual is often planted by cults or enemies of organized temples.

magic_items.name: Tome of Mystical Equations (P)
magic_items.description:
**Tome of Mystical Equations** is a rare book that grants insight into divine spell manipulation.

- Usable only by priests.
- Reading the book for 1 week grants the reader the ability to:
  - Cast one additional 1st-level priest spell per day.
  - Gain a +1 bonus to saving throws vs. arcane magic.
- These effects are permanent, but the book crumbles to dust after use.

Only the first person to read the tome receives the benefit.

magic_items.name: Trimia's Catalogue of Outer Plane Artifacts (W)
magic_items.description:
**Trimia's Catalogue of Outer Plane Artifacts** is a wizard’s reference for extraplanar magic.

- Takes 3 weeks to study.
- Once read, the wizard permanently gains:
  - +1 to saving throws against planar effects (e.g., *maze*, *banishment*).
  - The ability to recognize major planar artifacts on sight.
- Grants knowledge of 1 random spell from the *conjuration/summoning* school.
- The tome remains intact and can be resold, though its magic is inert for further use.

Highly prized in wizard colleges and among planewalkers.

magic_items.name: Amulet of Extension (W)
magic_items.description:
**Amulet of Extension (W)** enhances the duration of spells cast by the wearer.

- All spells with a fixed duration are extended by 50% (rounded up).
- Does not affect instantaneous or permanent spells.
- Usable only by wizards.
- Multiple amulets do not stack.

magic_items.name: Amulet of Far Reaching (W)
magic_items.description:
**Amulet of Far Reaching (W)** increases the range of spells cast by the wearer.

- Spell ranges are doubled, except for spells with a range of touch.
- Usable only by wizards.
- Particularly useful for long-range combat or remote casting.

magic_items.name: Amulet of Leadership
magic_items.description:
**Amulet of Leadership** bolsters the wearer's command presence.

- +2 bonus to Charisma for the purposes of reaction checks and loyalty.
- Morale of followers and hirelings improves by +1.
- May cause jealousy in rival leaders or generals.

magic_items.name: Amulet of Magic Resistance
magic_items.description:
**Amulet of Magic Resistance** protects the wearer from magical effects.

- Grants 20% magic resistance.
- Stacks with other sources of resistance, but only one amulet can be worn.
- Rare and highly prized by warriors and nobles alike.

magic_items.name: Amulet of Metaspell Influence (W)
magic_items.description:
**Amulet of Metaspell Influence (W)** alters the effect of the wearer’s spells.

- 3/day, the wearer may cast any memorized spell with a +1 level enhancement:
  - E.g., fireball does +1 die of damage, charm lasts +1 round, etc.
- Cannot be combined with other metamagic effects.
- Usable only by wizards.

magic_items.name: Amulet of Perpetual Youth
magic_items.description:
**Amulet of Perpetual Youth** slows aging and maintains youthful appearance.

- Wearer ceases to physically age.
- Does not prevent death by old age, but keeps appearance and attributes.
- Common among elven nobles and long-lived sorcerers.

magic_items.name: Brooch of Number Numbing
magic_items.description:
**Brooch of Number Numbing** confounds divination and count-based magic.

- Wearer cannot be detected by spells that count, estimate, or quantify.
- Examples: *detect life*, *locate object*, or *know alignment* fail to include wearer.
- Has no effect on direct detection like *see invisible*.

magic_items.name: Gem of Retaliation
magic_items.description:
**Gem of Retaliation** stores spell energy and returns it to the attacker.

- When the wearer is targeted by a spell, roll 1d6:
  - On a 6, the spell is absorbed and reflected at the caster.
- Works 3 times per day.
- After the third use, the gem must recharge for 24 hours.

magic_items.name: Medallion of Spell Exchange (W)
magic_items.description:
**Medallion of Spell Exchange (W)** allows spontaneous casting at a cost.

- 1/day, the wearer may exchange one memorized spell for another of equal or lesser level.
- The substituted spell must have been previously memorized in the past 24 hours.
- Usable only by wizards.

magic_items.name: Necklace of Memory Enhancement
magic_items.description:
**Necklace of Memory Enhancement** improves memorization and retention.

- Wearer can memorize one additional spell per spell level up to 3rd level.
- Must be worn during spell study.
- Popular among academic mages and battle-priests.

magic_items.name: Scarab of Uncertainty
magic_items.description:
**Scarab of Uncertainty** causes spells targeting the wearer to behave erratically.

- 50% chance any spell cast on the wearer (beneficial or harmful) is delayed by 1d4 rounds.
- Delay is random and not under the caster’s control.
- Scarab functions continuously while worn.

magic_items.name: Talisman of Memorization (W)
magic_items.description:
**Talisman of Memorization (W)** enhances a wizard’s daily preparations.

- 2/day, the wearer may memorize one spell in half the usual time.
- Also grants +1 bonus to Int checks when studying rare tomes or deciphering scrolls.
- Usable only by wizards.

magic_items.name: Robe of Repetition (P,W)
magic_items.description:
This ordinary-looking robe radiates strong alteration magic if magic is detected. The wearer of this robe acquires a unique and powerful augmentation to his magic. After casting a spell, there is a percentage chance that a mnemonic/harmonic effect occurs so that the magical energies liberated in spellcasting are amplified and retained briefly. The wizard is then able to cast the same spell a second time. This must be done on the succeeding round or the bonus spell is lost.

Once the spell has been cast a second time, the energy is completely liberated. There is no possibility of a third casting. In all cases, the spell is lost from the wizard's memory until the wizard memorizes it again.

The chance of a spell being available for a second casting varies according to spell level:

| Spell Level | Chance |
|-------------|--------|
| 1st         | 50%    |
| 2nd         | 40%    |
| 3rd         | 30%    |
| 4th         | 20%    |
| 5th         | 10%    |

Energy from spells of 6th level and above are not retained within the robe’s magical weave. Furthermore, a maximum of **24 spell levels per day** can be reused with the benefit of this robe. If the wizard opts not to use a spell which is made available for a second use, this still counts toward the maximum limit.

If a wizard removes the robe, spells cast while the robe is off do not count toward the robe’s daily limit. For example, if a wizard casts 15 spell levels that count against the robe’s daily limit and he then removes the robe, subsequent spells do not count against the robe’s limit. If the wizard then puts on the robe during the same day and casts more spells, the robe retains the 15 spell levels that counted against it and all spells cast subsequently also count against the robe.

Only one wizard may use the robe’s magic in a single day; if a second wizard puts on the robe, it does not function.

magic_items.name: Bracers of Brandishing
magic_items.description:
These unpredictable and bewildering items appear similar to other magical bracers, but their magic is revealed only when the character wearing them uses a charged rod, staff, or wand.

When a charge is expended from such an item, the bracers of brandishing alter the charge expenditure and the local balance of magical forces in a chaotic manner. The drain on the charged rod, staff, or wand is actually in the range of 5 charges to -4 (i.e., the item is recharged). The number of charges used is 1d10 - 5 (with negative results indicating that charges are restored). If an item is reduced below zero charges by a drain, it crumbles into dust immediately.

Items that are not normally rechargeable can be recharged through the chaotic operation of these items except for the rod of absorption.

magic_items.name: Fur of Warmth
magic_items.description:
These large, white furs (5' by 8') are reportedly taken from the skins of creatures native to the para-elemental plane of Ice. A person wearing the fur still feels cold in a cold environment (such as the para-elemental plane of Ice), but does not suffer damage from exposure.

Anyone wrapped in the fur is immune to the natural effects of cold, including the environments of the inner planes. Anyone wearing the fur takes half-damage from cold-based attacks. The wearer need not be covered completely by the fur to receive the enchanted protection; the fur must simply be draped over him like a cape. If the fur is cut into more than one piece, it loses its magical property.

If the fur is worn in pleasant or hot weather, it affects the wearer as any other large fur would.

magic_items.name: Reglar's Gloves of Freedom
magic_items.description:
These gloves appear to be thick, leather, combat gloves. Silvered pearls are sewn along the stitching.

A character under the influence of a charm spell or similar enchantment can be freed of the enchantment by shaking hands with the wearer of the gloves. This item frees only characters who are enchanted against their will. Those who have willingly submitted to a charm (such as a quest) are not affected by the gloves. The former victim retains all memories of his enchantment.

The gloves do not protect or release the wearer from such spells.

magic_items.name: School Cap (W)
magic_items.description:
The wearer of this cap gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against spells of one particular school of magic. In addition, specialists of the designated school do not inflict a -1 penalty on a wearer's saving throws against their specialist spells. The nature of the school cap is determined using a 1d8 roll.

| d8 Roll | Affected School          |
|---------|--------------------------|
| 1       | Abjuration               |
| 2       | Conjuration/Summoning    |
| 3       | Greater Divination       |
| 4       | Enchantment/Charm        |
| 5       | Illusion                 |
| 6       | Invocation/Evocation     |
| 7       | Necromancy               |
| 8       | Alteration               |

Of these caps, **10% are mixed blessings**, since they have a cursed side-effect: The wearer suffers a -1 penalty to saving throws against spells of the opposition school(s). The curse takes effect the first time the wearer is subjected to a spell from the opposition school(s). Once the curse has been engaged, the cap cannot be removed except through a *remove curse* spell.

magic_items.name: Bag of Bones (P)
magic_items.description:
This item, usable only by priests, is a small, ordinary-looking leather pouch that contains a number of tiny bones. When these bones are scattered over a 40 by 20 yard area and the word of command is spoken, a unit of skeletons immediately springs from the ground. This unit comprises eight BATTLESYSTEM™ rules figures of skeletons (80 skeletons) armed with swords.

The statistics for this unit are: AD 6, AR 8, Hits 1, ML n/a, MV 12".  
(Hits from piercing and slashing weapons are reduced by half.)

The unit unconditionally obeys the combat orders of the priest, never checking morale. The unit fights until totally destroyed or until the sun sets (at which time the remaining skeletons crumble into dust). Two out of three (1–66 on 1d100) of these bags are “one-shot” magical items: once the bones are used, they are gone forever. One out of three (67–100 on 1d100) bags magically replenishes itself every sunset if the bones have been used.

A bag of bones will work only on a battlefield in the full heat of battle. (For the purposes of this definition, a “battlefield” is a place where units are in conflict and where at least 100 individuals per side are involved.) The unit will never split up, and will obey no orders other than to enter combat.

Certain war deities may frown upon the use of undead or conjured troops, believing them to be unworthy and cowardly. Priests worshipping these deities may suffer divine consequences if they choose to use a bag of bones.

magic_items.name: Flatbox
magic_items.description:
A practical example of hypergeometry and hypermathematics, the flatbox appears to be a wooden box about 3' long, 2' wide, and two inches deep. It weighs eight pounds. The top of the box is a hinged lid.

When the lid is opened, the interior of the box is filled with impenetrable darkness. This darkness cannot be dispelled by any form of magic; it is a characteristic of the hypergeometrical topography of the box.

Although from the outside the flatbox appears to be only two inches deep, it actually has the internal volume of a box six feet deep. (Thus, it has a volume of 36 cubic feet.) The maximum weight that can be loaded into a flatbox is 500 pounds. No matter how much of its volume is filled, the flatbox still weighs only eight pounds.

Since the inside of the box is completely dark, the only way to retrieve a specific item is to feel around within the box. Finding an object this way takes 1d4 rounds.

There is a significant danger associated with the flatbox. If it is taken into an extradimensional space (such as within a *portable hole*), if it is teleported, *gated*, or transported via dimensional folding or any analogous method, or if it ever suffers 15 hit points of damage, the flatbox explodes violently. This explosion destroys all contents of the box and inflicts 4d10 hit points of damage on any creature within 20 feet (save vs. spell for half damage).

magic_items.name: Jar of Preserving
magic_items.description:
This piece of magical glassware is able to hold up to one cubic foot of material. The round jar is equipped with a glass lid that screws into place.

Any animal or vegetable matter placed in a jar of preserving enters a form of suspended animation. A rosebud never wilts, for example, and a small animal never ages and does not require food, water, or air. Spell components placed in the jar never lose potency.

magic_items.name: Nefradina's Identifier (W)
magic_items.description:
This highly valued item is a magical test kit used to identify potions, powders, and other alchemical substances. It consists of a wooden box (typically measuring 1'×1'×3') containing an assortment of vials, flasks, and beakers in small, padded compartments. Also in the box is a copy of a text called *Nefradina's Codex*. This book instructs the owner on how to use the test kit.

When the owner wishes to identify a potion, powder, oil, perfume, or similar liquid or powdered magical item, he looks up the substance's characteristics (odor, color, consistency, and so on) in the codex and follows the directions given to create a test mixture by combining a number of ingredients found in the kit. He then adds a drop of the test mixture to the substance he wishes to identify.

magic_items.name: Tenser's Portmanteau of Frugality (W)
magic_items.description:
This moderately large, black leather traveling case contains a bewildering number of small instruments—tweezers, measuring beakers, small ceramic jars, and the like. It can be used to extract the greatest possible benefit from certain single-use magical items by partly diluting or admixing them. All potions, oils, dusts, incenses, glues, solvents, and Nolzur's marvelous pigments can be affected by Tenser's portmanteau.

For every two potions, applications of dust, or similar substances that are treated by the portmanteau, a third active dose or use can be extracted. Any such item may be affected only once by the power of the portmanteau. Single doses (a single potion, etc.) do not provide sufficient magic for treatment by the portmanteau.

The process of extracting the magic is not a simple task. The work takes 2d6 hours to complete. At the end of this time, the wizard must make an Intelligence check. If successful, the third dose is created. If failed, the third dose fails and only enough remains of the original materials for a single dose of the magical substance.

If *Alamir's fundamental breakdown* is cast during the process, the wizard gains a +2 to his Intelligence check. In this situation, the spell does not consume the magical items on which it is cast.

Each use of the portmanteau consumes some of the special agents required for the process. When discovered, the case holds enough materials to attempt 4d10 duplications.

magic_items.name: Thought Bottle
magic_items.description:
This item usually takes the form of a metal flask similar in appearance to an efreeti bottle. Bottle and stopper are usually engraved with intricate runes. The bottle can be used to store and protect important memories and thoughts, and is often used by powerful characters as a way of managing their (potentially cluttered) memories.

To use the bottle, a character concentrates on the thought or memory to be stored. He then uncorks the bottle and speaks the word of command. The thought or memory is then transferred from the character's brain into the bottle. All details of the thought or memory are held within the bottle. The caster remembers the general nature of the thought but need not worry about forgetting specific details, since these are trapped in the thought bottle.

To retrieve a thought, a character uncorks the bottle and speaks another word of command. The thought or memory is then transferred directly into the user's brain.

Thought bottles are sometimes used to protect vital information. A messenger carrying vital plans through enemy territory where there is a significant chance of capture and subsequent interrogation might carry all sensitive plans in one or more bottles. The messenger does not know the contents or the command word and therefore cannot reveal the contents of the bottles. Likewise, a spy could gain secret information, transfer it to a thought bottle, then use *forget* or *modify memory* to wipe this information from his mind. After this, regardless of the methods used, the spy is incapable of revealing the sensitive information.

Thought bottles are sometimes used as "memory archives," where characters can save memories that are cluttering up their minds. This would be more of a problem for long-lived races such as elves, since the sheer volume of memories recorded over several centuries could be overwhelming.

Thought bottles will function (in both storage and retrieval) for any intelligent creature.

When discovered, 75% of all thought bottles can hold only a single thought or memory. The remaining 25% have a capacity of 2d4 separate thoughts or memories. There is a separate word of command for each "thought slot."

magic_items.name: Candle of Propitiousness
magic_items.description:
This candle enhances attacks against a particular enemy within a defined area. The user lights the candle while speaking the exact name of a single foe.

If the exact name is not known, the user must precisely identify the foe; saying, "the evil warrior" isn't precise enough, but stating, "the evil warrior who rules the village of Fair Meadows and carries a golden shield" is sufficient.

All characters who remain within a 50-foot radius of the lighted candle receive a +2 bonus to all attack rolls made against the stated foe, regardless of whether the foe is within 50 feet of the candle. Characters who venture outside the area of effect lose the bonus. When the stated foe is within the area of effect, he suffers a -1 penalty to all his attack rolls.

There can be no interposing surfaces such as walls or doors between the candle of propitiousness and characters whom it affects. The stated foe is not allowed a saving throw to resist the effects of the candle.

The candle of propitiousness burns for up to one hour. If it is moved after it has been lit, its magic is immediately and permanently negated. Likewise, if its flame is extinguished, its magic immediately ends. Any magical or natural force capable of extinguishing a normal flame, such as a gust of wind or a splash of water, can extinguish a candle of propitiousness.

A candle of propitiousness can be lit and used only once.

magic_items.name: Dust of Mind Dulling
magic_items.description:
This harmless-looking dust is the bane of spellcasters. One pinch of this dust can be flung up to 30 feet from the user and will scatter to fill a 5-foot-radius sphere.

All spellcasters within the area must make a saving throw versus spell or find their minds dulled and their wits slowed. All casting times less than 1 round are increased by 2 as the wizards hesitate, trying to remember the procedures.

magic_items.name: Powder of the Black Veil
magic_items.description:
This sooty, black powder causes temporary magical blindness to all those in the area of effect. If a creature's saving throw is successful, he suffers no effects. If the roll fails, the creature is blinded and suffers a -4 penalty to attack rolls, a -4 penalty to Armor Class, and a +2 penalty to initiative rolls.

Blindness persists each round until the victim succeeds at a saving throw vs. spell, at which time the effect is instantly negated. An entire packet or blow tube must be used for each application.

magic_items.name: Powder of Coagulation
magic_items.description:
When placed on an open wound, a pinch of this yellow powder stops all bleeding and heals 1d6 hit points of damage. Each pouch or packet contains 4d4 pinches.

A blow tube contains one use, but stops bleeding and heals 1d4 hit points for all creatures in the area of effect.

magic_items.name: Powder of the Hero's Heart
magic_items.description:
When used, this dull red powder instills bravery in all creatures within the area of effect (both friends and enemies). It grants such creatures a morale bonus of +2 and negates the effects of magical fear.

The effect lasts for 5d4 rounds. An entire packet, pouch, or blow tube must be used for each application.

magic_items.name: Powder of Magic Detection
magic_items.description:
Under close inspection, this ordinary-looking powder can be seen for what it truly is—an extremely fine powder of minute, crystalline granules.

When this powder contacts a magical object, the crystals spark and flash with a rainbow of colors. This effect does not reveal the nature or intensity of the enchantment—only that the item is magical.

A small pinch of powder is needed for each use, no matter how large or small the object. Each packet contains 1d10+10 pinches. Powder that is placed on a nonmagical item yields no effect and cannot be reused.

magic_items.name: Puchezma's Powder of Edible Objects
magic_items.description:
An inveterate traveler who was notoriously cheap, Puchezma could never bring himself to spend money on decent provisions or hire a quality chef for his long wilderness excursions. In his efforts to create a seasoning that would make the bland dishes of his second-rate cooks more palatable, Puchezma stumbled on a formula for this powder.

This powder, which resembles normal salt, causes any normally indigestible material to become edible, nutritious food. The material must be nonliving and nonmagical, and must be in a form the consumer can swallow; for instance, dirt and cotton cloth are acceptable, but large stones and planks of hard wood are not (they would need to be broken up first). All poisonous and otherwise harmful properties (such as sharp edges) are negated by the powder.

One pinch of powder is sufficient to treat one cubic foot of material. The powder is normally found in small bags containing 10 to 100 pinches.

magic_items.name: Salves of Far Seeing
magic_items.description:
These salves allow a character who puts a drop of the salve into each of his eyes to see as well as he would on a brightly lit day on his Prime Material plane. The proper salve also serves as a protection against blindness on planes where protection is necessary. Several types of salves exist for the different elemental, para-elemental, and quasi-elemental planes. The salves have no effect on normal or magical blindness.

The salves are found in small metal containers made of precious metals. A container contains 4d12 drops of salve. One drop in each eye bestows the magical property for one day. A drop must be placed in every usable eye for the magic to work.

A different salve exists for each of the planes where such a salve is required, and each has a distinct look and feel. The following table lists the planes that limit sight and the color and texture of each respective salve. The salves function only on their respective planes.

| Plane     | Color        | Texture        |
|-----------|--------------|----------------|
| Water     | Blue         | Smooth         |
| Earth     | Black        | Grainy, Thick  |
| Positive  | White        | Opaque Liquid  |
| Negative  | Clear        | Liquid         |
| Smoke     | Ashen        | Liquid         |
| Ice       | Bluish-white | Thick          |
| Ooze      | Gray         | Rubbery        |
| Magma     | Copper       | Thick          |
| Steam     | Gray         | Liquid         |
| Salt      | White        | Grainy         |
| Radiance  | Golden       | Smooth         |
| Ash       | Gray         | Grainy         |
| Minerals  | Silver       | Grainy         |
| Dust      | Black        | Dry            |

magic_items.name: Warp Marble
magic_items.description:
This item is a small (½-inch diameter) sphere of fine crystal, often appearing with a rich blue or aquamarine hue. Each marble has three words of command associated with it.

- The **first** command triggers the marble to create an extradimensional space large enough to contain a single large-sized creature. When this word is spoken, the closest creature to the marble is instantly transported to and imprisoned within this space. Similar to the *seclusion* spell, the inhabitant of this space can see and hear events in the “real world,” but can do nothing to affect anything outside the prison. Spellcasting and use of psionics are impossible while within the prison. If the prison is already occupied, this word of command has no effect.

- The **second** command word releases the occupant, who is immediately returned to the “real world” within three feet of the marble (wherever it might be). This word can be spoken from within the prison.

- The **third** command sets the marble as a trap. The first creature to touch the marble is subject to its magic. If thrown or used against another creature, a successful attack roll is required, and the target is allowed a saving throw versus spell. Success means no effect; failure means the creature is trapped.

If the marble is taken into an extradimensional space, teleported, gated, or shifted to another plane, the occupant is expelled into the Astral Plane.

magic_items.name: Crucible of Melting (W)
magic_items.description:
This small porcelain or clay bowl melts any metal placed within it when the command word is spoken. It heats to the necessary temperature in one turn and has no effect on non-metal substances. It holds up to one cubic foot of material.

Each use carries a 5% chance of a mishap that causes an explosion for 3d10 damage in a 10-foot radius (save vs. rod/staff/wand for half damage). Magic items within must save vs. magical fire or be destroyed. The crucible itself must save vs. disintegration or be destroyed.

Half of all crucibles remain hot for 3 turns; the rest require a second command word to deactivate.

magic_items.name: Everbountiful Soup Kettle
magic_items.description: When this two-gallon metal kettle is filled with water, the liquid is transformed into steaming, nutritious vegetable soup. One full kettle is sufficient to provide a single meal for up to six normal appetites. No ingredients are required for the soup, nor is heat necessary. Any nonmagical, nonpoisonous liquid can be used in place of water. The everbountiful soup kettle can be used once per day.

magic_items.name: Forge of Metal Protection
magic_items.description:
The first of these heavy (1,000 lb.) forges was created an unknown number of centuries ago. Because of the specific magical properties involved, it is believed that a wizard, assisted by a number of dwarves (all of whom were interested in planar research), constructed the device. Although the secret of the construction has since spread, the forge is an extremely rare magical item.

The forge is a furnace made up of enchanted rocks held together with a network of steel rods. When metal armor and weapons are placed within the furnace and heated to glowing red, the armor becomes immune to the effects of heat on the inner planes. All metal items tempered in this manner suffer no ill effects from heat on any of the inner planes, but suffer the effects of heat normally on the Prime Material plane.

The effect of the magical protection lasts 12 to 30 days (2d10+10). Magical armor or weapons that are placed in the forge take on the protection from heat, but temporarily lose their other magical properties. Thus, a sword +2 placed in the forge will not melt on the plane of Fire, but it ceases to function as a sword +2 until the enchantment wears off. A weapon with an ego retains its ego, but loses all of its other magical properties.

magic_items.name: Glass of Preserved Words
magic_items.description:
This magical magnifying glass has a band of silver around the lens and an ivory handle. The glass has the ability to make illegible written words readable. Words that were carved into stone but worn away through time, inked letters blurred due to moisture, messages clouded by magic, and magical and normal writings all become clear when read through the glass.

The actual words remain illegible; they are not altered in any way. Only a character looking at them through the glass can read them clearly.

The glass does not protect the reader from any harmful effects as a result of a cursed scroll or trapped writings, nor does it make cryptically worded or coded messages understandable.

magic_items.name: Horn of Valor
magic_items.description:
This golden horn is indistinguishable from any other magical horn until it is sounded. When sounded, each unit hearing it who is allied with or loyal to the character sounding the horn gains the following benefits. First, the unit gains a +2 bonus to its morale for 1d4 BATTLESYSTEM rules turns. Second, any routed friendly unit who hears it immediately makes a rally check with a bonus of 2 to its morale (for that check only). (This check is made when the horn is sounded—during the magic phase—rather than in the rally phase. If this additional check is failed, the unit is entitled to a second check in the rally phase, as normal.)

Enemy units who hear the horn are also affected: they suffer a -1 penalty to morale for 1d2 BATTLESYSTEM rules turns.

Under normal conditions, the sound of the horn can be heard at a range of 24”. Unusual conditions, such as a raging storm, can decrease this range, but the horn can always be heard at a range of 9” (unless the character blowing the horn is within an area of magical silence, of course).

The horn of valor can be sounded only once per BATTLESYSTEM Rules turn, and no more than three times in any 12-hour period. If blown a fourth time within this period, it becomes totally nonmagical for 1d6 days, and any effects remaining from earlier soundings immediately terminate. Effects from multiple soundings are not cumulative. (Instantaneous effects such as the automatic rally check for friendly units take place each time the horn is sounded.)

magic_items.name: Hourglass of Fire and Ice (W)
magic_items.description:
This small, wooden-framed hourglass looks quite ordinary but radiates invocation/evocation magic if detected. Half these hourglasses contain red sand and half contain blue sand.

An hourglass containing red sand in the lower portion enables a spellcaster to cast fire-based spells with increased potency: +1 per die of damage. Further, victims suffer a -1 penalty to all saves against such spells.

After 6 turns, the red sand flows upward through the central aperture, turning blue as it passes. When the hourglass has filled with blue sand, cold-based spells cast by the owner deal +1 per die of damage. Victims also suffer a -1 penalty to saving throws against cold-based spells, including saves against illusions of cold.

The hourglass may be inverted to re-create the red sand, with a corresponding flip in the effects after 6 turns.

The hourglass may be inverted up to three times per day. However, with every inversion of the hourglass there is a 1% chance that it will break, spilling its sands and losing its magic forever.

magic_items.name: Lens of Speed Reading
magic_items.description: While looking through this lens, the user can read any book, document, or other written material at three times his normal speed with full comprehension. When used in conjunction with *read magic*, the lens of speed reading enables the user to quickly scan scrolls and magical tomes to learn their contents, but it has no effect on the time required to cast spells. The lens will not decipher codes, improve illegible writing, or allow magic to be read without the proper spells.

magic_items.name: Lorloveim's Obsidian Mortar and Pestle
magic_items.description:
This magical tool allows the wielder to grind even the hardest materials into a fine powder. Rocks, metals, and even gemstones of all types may be ground to dust in as little as 1d4 rounds.

Magical items pounded beneath the pestle are allowed a saving throw vs. disintegration. If the save is successful, the enchanted item cannot be destroyed in this fashion. If the saving throw fails, the item is reduced to nonmagical powder.

The obsidian mortar is commonly used by wizards in the preparation of spell components and ingredients for magical items. Neither the mortar nor the pestle is effective without the other.

magic_items.name: Mirror of Retention
magic_items.description:
This appears to be an ordinary round silver mirror, about 12 inches in diameter. When the mirror of retention is hung in a 50-foot × 50-foot or smaller room and the command word is spoken, the mirror records all events occurring in the room for 24 hours. During this time, the mirror of retention appears to be a normal mirror.

When the command word is spoken again, the mirror replays all the events it recorded. The events appear as a series of silent images in the surface of the mirror. By rotating the mirror clockwise, the images can be accelerated, appearing as much as 10 times as fast as they occurred. Rotating the mirror counter-clockwise causes the images to appear in reverse. If the mirror is held parallel to the floor, the image freezes. Thus, by rotating the mirror and freezing the images, the user can scan for events, review previously viewed images, or freeze selected images for closer study.

When the command word is spoken a third time, the mirror of retention is cleared of all images and is ready to record new images for another 24 hours.

magic_items.name: Mirror of Simple Order
magic_items.description:
When a character steps in front of this mirror, he sees a strangely distorted image of himself. The reflection moves as he does, but the face reflected in the mirror is the image of an ordinary face. There are eyes, a mouth, and a nose, but all lack character. Although the figure moves as the character does, it is shorter or taller than he is, adjusted in whatever direction approaches the average height of the character’s race. Any clothing worn by the character is altered as well. Bright colors will be muted, appearing to be shades of grey. Any ornamental work on armor, weapons, or clothing will be gone.

If the character stands in front of the mirror for more than two rounds, he is instantly polymorphed into the image in the mirror. The polymorphed character must succeed on a system shock roll to survive the change.

Like the polymorph other spell, there is a chance that the subject’s personality and mentality change into that of the new form. In this case, each of his ability scores becomes 11 and his hit points become the average for his Hit Dice at his level. He retains his level and class, but is not as exceptional as he might have been. He is bland and boring. The character’s alignment changes to lawful neutral, and he becomes interested in little else other than setting order to the world. He passionlessly travels to wipe out chaos wherever he finds it.

All effects of the mirror can be removed through a dispel magic spell. Until the effects are removed, however, the character is unaware that any change has occurred.

magic_items.name: Mordom's Cauldron of Air
magic_items.description:
Mordom's cauldron of air is a round pot about two feet in diameter, weighing 60 pounds. There are two handles on either side of the pot and a compartment built like a small shelf under the cauldron. The compartment can be filled with wood or coal to heat the cauldron.

Although the device is heavy and bulky, the cauldron is valuable for characters planning an expedition to a place with little or no air. The cauldron functions as an air generator. To operate the device, the cauldron is filled with water and a fire is lit in the compartment. When the water boils, vapor is released. The air from the vapor creates a bubble of breathable air 10 feet in radius centered on the cauldron.

The water must not be allowed to spill out of the cauldron and the fire must be kept burning. As long as these conditions are met, the cauldron will provide air continuously.

The air produced is the same temperature as the surrounding environment. The device needs a minimum of one gallon of water per hour.

magic_items.name: Philosopher's Egg (W)
magic_items.description:
This item is an enchanted receptacle used in alchemical laboratories. The philosopher’s egg is in the shape of an egg, crafted from crystal or mundane fluid. The egg has two distinct functions.

First, it may be used to transmute a fluid into another type by cutting the egg in half and pouring in the fluid. The result depends on the nature of the liquid and the DM’s discretion.

Second, the egg is used as a component in the legendary process to create the philosopher’s stone—thus, it is sometimes said by wizards that the stone hatches from the egg.

magic_items.name: Pick of Earth Parting
magic_items.description: This enchanted pick allows its wielder to cut through elemental earth quickly. The wielder of the pick must have Strength of 17 or better. By repeatedly swinging the pick at elemental earth, the wielder can carve out a 10' x 10' x 60' tunnel per round. The pick’s magical properties create a smooth, clean surface regardless of the mining skill of the user. All rubble from the excavation magically disappears, leaving a clear passage.

magic_items.name: Skie's Locks and Bolts
magic_items.description:
This device looks like a small, ornate lock with a tiny silver key. When the key is turned clockwise, all doors, windows and other portals within 50 feet of the item slam shut and become wizard locked. For purposes of opening them, the wizard locks are the equivalent of those cast by a 12th-level wizard. The effect lasts until the key is twisted counterclockwise or the device is transported more than 50 feet away.

Skie’s locks and bolts are sometimes found in the homes of wealthy merchants and secretive wizards.

magic_items.name: Tapestry of Disease Warding
magic_items.description:
This is a 3-foot-square cotton tapestry bearing the image of a rainbow. When hung in a house or other building (10,000 square feet or less), it protects the occupants from nonmagical diseases. It has no effect on persons already suffering from diseases, but protects healthy characters from contracting contagious diseases ranging from common colds to deadly plagues. The tapestry offers no protection against any disease caused by magic or of a magical nature.

The tapestry is subject to rips, fire, and other damage, although it is allowed a saving throw. Its magic is permanent only as long as it remains intact. The tapestry may be moved to a new location, but has no effect outdoors.

magic_items.name: Zwann's Watering Can (P)
magic_items.description:
Invented by botanist Salerno Zwann, this watering can must be filled with two gallons of water and left undisturbed for 30 days. Water from the can may then be sprinkled over a 25-foot-square patch of tilled soil.

Plants subsequently grown in this soil are permanently immune to disease, drought, insects, bad weather, and other nonmagical trauma. The water has no effect on existing plants. The treated soil remains effective for one year.

magic_items.name: Air Spores
magic_items.description:
Created by the wizard Mordom, these spores resemble pollen and are usually stored as study specimens. When ingested, the spores colonize a creature’s lungs, reproducing and dying over 2d4 days. During this time, they produce oxygen, enabling the creature to breathe in otherwise airless environments.

However, in normal environments, they hinder breathing, requiring all Constitution checks to be made at -4. To clear the lungs, a creature must spend 12 hours per spore-day breathing normal air.

magic_items.name: Bell's Palette of Identity
magic_items.description:
This magical artist's palette is covered with mystical paints. A user paints a self-portrait (no artistic skill required, only belief in accuracy) to create a magical proxy that protects the user against spells like *massmorph*, *polymorph other*, *polymorph any object*, or *seeming*.

If such a spell targets the user, the portrait instead suffers the effects of a failed saving throw. If the user's save succeeds, the spell fails normally. The portrait can only protect once; afterward, it is no longer effective.

In the plane of Hades, the portrait also absorbs the draining greyness of the plane, fading instead of the bearer. After two weeks, a saving throw must be made to maintain its power.

Each palette can produce 2–5 portraits.

magic_items.name: Claw of Magic Stealing (W)
magic_items.description:
This peculiar item is usually fashioned in the form of a miniature silver hand or claw. It can cast *spectral hand* three times per day, but this is only its secondary function.

When the claw strikes a wizard via *spectral hand*, the target must save vs. spell. If they fail, a random spell is drained from their memory and transferred to the claw's wielder. The wielder may then use this energy to cast a memorized spell of the same or lower level without losing it from memory. This must be done the following round, or the energy is lost.

magic_items.name: Contracts of Nepthas
magic_items.description:
These magical contracts are written in black ink on golden-brown vellum, typically stored in ivory tubes. Each contains 1d6 blank contracts.

When signed, the contract of Nepthas places an enchantment on signers to ensure compliance. Breaking the contract causes deafness, blindness, and muteness, curable only by *remove curse*. Affected individuals suffer major penalties in combat and saving throws.

Contracts require clearly stated terms and deadlines to activate. Vague language may be misinterpreted. Forged or coerced contracts are null. If a signer dies, remaining signers are still bound unless stated otherwise.

magic_items.name: Crystal Parrot
magic_items.description:
This is a 12-inch-high statue of a parrot made of clear crystal. When activated with a command word, it glows red behind the eyes and watches a 180° arc out to 50 feet.

It telepathically alerts the owner to intruders that match a preset description. Reports are brief and simple (“Two orcs enter”), and only include entry and exit, not behavior. It cannot see through darkness or physical barriers.

The parrot remains active for 30 days, after which it must be deactivated and left to rest for another 30 days before reactivation. It has AC 3 and shatters at 12 hp, alerting the user telepathically upon destruction.

magic_items.name: Dimensional Mine
magic_items.description:
This cursed item looks like a figurine of wondrous power but is extremely dangerous. If brought into an extradimensional space (like *rope trick* or a *bag of holding*), it destroys that space and expels all contents—including itself—into the Astral Plane.

The extradimensional item is also destroyed. There is no saving throw. The mine is typically disguised and intended to sabotage magical storage or transportation.

magic_items.name: Disintegration Chamber
magic_items.description:
These chambers are made of iron with mirrored interior walls and come in sizes ranging from 1' cubes to 10' x 10' x 10' rooms. They disintegrate contents as per the *disintegrate* spell.

To use it, place the material inside, shut the door, and activate the chamber. A sickly green light glows, and all contents vanish into dust. Each use consumes one of the chamber’s 81–100 charges. Objects or creatures can save vs. spell to resist. Larger chambers are stationary fixtures unless moved by special means.

magic_items.name: Elemental Compass
magic_items.description:
This device aids travelers seeking the elemental planes of Fire, Air, Water, or Earth. The compass, a small urn carved of stone and containing hollow pockets, works only in the Ethereal plane, an inner plane, or the Prime Material plane.

To make the compass work, a representative sample of material from the plane sought must be placed in the urn and the lid sealed. Thus, to find the elemental plane of Fire, a small, burning fire must be placed in the urn. Once sealed, the fire will burn until the lid is opened (just as water will not evaporate from the urn as long as the lid is sealed).

When used on an inner plane or the Ethereal plane, the urn glows yellow when the characters are heading in the direction of a portal of the elemental plane they seek. On an inner plane, the compass leads to the para- or quasi-elemental planar border that exists between planes. In the Ethereal plane, the urn leads to the Ethereal curtain of the desired plane. There are no range restrictions on the inner or Ethereal planes.

On the Prime Material plane, the compass glows when the characters are headed for elemental vortices of the correct element, provided the vortex is within range. The range on the Prime Material plane is 300 miles.

magic_items.name: Globe of Purification (P)
magic_items.description: These enchanted glass spheres, 6 inches in diameter, contain the swirling blue-grey essence of a *cloud of purification* spell. When the globe is broken, the cloud billows forth, acting exactly as if the spell had been cast by a 12th-level priest. These devices are often given to a city’s sanitation crews, who descend upon the streets and sewers during the wee hours of the morning.

magic_items.name: Globe of Serenity (P)
magic_items.description:
These glass orbs look very much like crystal balls. However, a globe of serenity emits a continuous, inaudible tone that affects all living creatures within 50 feet who fail a saving throw vs. spell. While in the area of effect, affected creatures feel the utmost serenity and self-control.

Creatures affected by the globe gain a +3 saving throw bonus to resist spells and special attacks that create emotional states (such as *charm*, *fear*, or *emotion*). At the same time, they suffer a -2 penalty to all Intelligence checks.

The globe also affects morale, raising the spirits of some while quelling the fires of fanaticism in others. All affected creatures have morale of 10, regardless of their training or skill. If a morale check is called for and failed, the affected creature does not rout or flee, but stays in place, taking no action until rallied.

Globes of serenity are best suited for lawful communities where open displays of emotion are frowned upon. Although crime and violence would be greatly reduced in these communities, citizens would also lack a sense of spirit. The people would go about their daily routines like emotionless automatons.

magic_items.name: Law's Banner (Wr)
magic_items.description:
This blazing red standard has the magical ability to raise the morale of troops when held at the front of a lawful army. The banner inspires any soldier in the army who is within a quarter-mile of the banner and can see the flag. Troops inspired in this manner receive a +2 modifier to their base morale as per *BATTLESYSTEM* rules.

In order for an army to be considered lawful, at least 90% of the troops must be of lawful alignment and no more than 1% can be chaotic.

If the banner falls, the effects are lost immediately. If the banner is raised within 1 turn, the effect returns. If the banner is not raised within 1 turn, the inspired troops become filled with dread, feeling that the battle has clearly gone against their cause. The same troops now suffer a -2 morale penalty for the duration of the battle.

The banner may be raised any number of times, but it can raise or impair morale only once per day.

magic_items.name: Liquid Road
magic_items.description:
When sprinkled on water, swampland, quicksand, or a similar surface, *liquid road* causes the terrain to harden to the density of granite, enabling easy passage. *Liquid road* is also effective in negating the effects of spells such as *transmute rock to mud*.
